Reviews.Title: “glass room”
Reviews.Author: catbearkiss
Reviews.Content: Location: Not in the city center, beside the hotel is a subway station, you only walk 2-4 minutes so it is accesible. Taxi driver has no difficulty finding the hotel. Near convenience stores, mall center and other restaurants. Exterior: Beautiful designs and the hotel is new. Interior: high ceiling, artsy lounge area, there are wooden arts install at the lobby. Frontdesk: Very accommodating and speak English very well. We have no problem checking in and out. Room: The room was amazing, as what you see in the pictures, all glass! You can have full view of the cityscape or sea (depending where your room is facing at) so make sure to have the highest floor. When we stayed there, we even saw some large birds! The bed is huge and change the beddings everyday, it has huge flatscreen behind a wall-art-painting-two door sliding cabinet, and at the head board a mural painting, really cool, esp for honeymooners. If you change clothes or do some “private” thingy, make sure to pull down the blinds if you don’t want to be photographed, watched, recorded by people staying at nearby hotel. Thumbs-down-note: over all it’s cool but the bathroom is made of all glass as well so when taking a bath if the lights are not switched off or the blinds are up, you will give some “live and free” showdown for all the eyes there and for your room mate. The bathroom also do not have doors, so the cool breeze from the air condition unit will freeze you while showering hehehe, good thing the toilet has door though it’s still all glass, no smell will come out lols! Overall, it was fun and highly recommend this place, value for money is worth it. Will come again!

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: allan m
Reviews.Content: I Was here for 5 days this hotel has a very friendly staff, and this hotel is a very safe and secured, i recommend this hotel! very nice interior also. It is near the mtr This place may not be an ideal location for the tourist. visit the sugar bar on the 32nd floor very nice bar and awesome view.

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View....!”
Reviews.Author: Genista
Reviews.Content: Definitely a business hotel....functional, a bit sterile and soulless, and ghastly Muzak in the lifts. Our room was on the 11th floor and so had an intriguing view over to the apartment block opposite. Each day of our week's stay there I would check to see if they had taken the lone pair of pants off the line...surely they must have been dry? . But no, they were our daily view throughout our stay ! (Harbour view room is more expensive but probably worth it ) However, the hotel served us well. The staff were helpful and friendly. Reasonable breakfast, Great views from the roof top bar, Close proximity to the MTR meant an easy and speedy journey to Central and other districts. Clean , light, and comfortable room with all the usual toiletries, gels, slippers, iron and ironing board, vast TV , air con, etc. I was the only person in the swimming pool which was great, except I felt a bit like a goldfish in a bowl as it is overlooked by apartment blocks. Close to City Plaza shopping mall if that is what you like. Very easy and safe just to walk out of the hotel and keep walking all day...the best way to savour the delights of Hong Kong...Lively , sprawling markets, hundreds of tiny shops and intriguing alleys... a cacophony of sights, sounds, smells, colours .

Reviews.Title: “The best in the area... by a country mile”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: East is spotless, has perfect service levels, beautifully and cleverly designed rooms and is pretty reasonable. Don't be put off by the location, Taikoo Shing has some great shopping (and there is a mall connected to the hotel as is the metro) and a 30 HKD ride to Central. Best of all is the roof top bar Sugar. Spectacular views, cooler than a Polar bear and again it won't fleece you. Be careful with the breakfast, its around £20, wonderful but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great location in non-touristy residential/shopping area”
Reviews.Author: TinaWC
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for about a week visiting family. Great location as there are tons of restaurants and shopping nearby. It's right next to the underground metro station so it's very convenient to go anywhere. It's not touristy areas like Causeway Bay or Mongkok where you see crowds everywhere. The room was small but enough for my husband and me plus a travel crib for our baby. The entire hotel has new and modern decor. The bar there is a popular hangout place for the young t0 middle age bourgeoisie. Staff was helpful and friendly. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “East Hong Kong .. ultra modern a different hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Neil M
Reviews.Content: An amazingly modern hotel that was comfortable and almost exotic in the feeling you have in the rooms. Decor is open plan (even the shower) with swages of dark marble and white fittings. Surrouned by open window made the feeling a little exposed with flats opposite able to see it, but the blinds dealt with that. I was there on business and never felt isolated in a dark depresing room as one can in so many 5 star hotels. This one was alive and fresh. Would be wonderful for a romantic couple to share ..almost Hollywood in HK!! Servise model in the foyer takes some getting used to .. there's no hierachy, all staff do everything, so don't look for a concierge, a cashier, a booking cler its all do all. A bit frustrating at times, that made it feel inefficient, but staff attitude is so professional and helpful that it compensated. Location is a little remote from central HK, being near the business district with a large shopping complex next door with food and convenience there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelexpertdotcom
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the East Hotel about half a dozen times now. It's a good business hotel, but is quite a distance out. If you stay in a room lower down than the 25th floor, you're facing into blocks of flats. Ok if you don't mind people watching you getting changed (or vice versa!) Otherwise, you'll be sitting in your room with the blinds down. No business rooms here - or a lobby to relax in. But breakfast is good - and the top floor bar is a nice place for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel; a bit far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Antoine S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really stunning: great design, good service, very high tech (sometimes a bit anecdotic). The rooms are amazing (I had the chance to be upgraded to a suite). The bar at the roof top is cool and busy, with great view. Gym club and pool are a bit small but fine The hotel is just a bit out of the city, which may be great if you want to avoid the noise of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great all rounded hotel for my business trips”
Reviews.Author: Silvia S
Reviews.Content: Second business trip to Hong Kong and second time I stay here, and I love it. In the Eastern part of Hong Kong island, connected to one otheir best shopping malls (Tai Koo Shing) in that area. The hotel has around 32 floors, so many rooms have impressive views, with floor to cealing windows and pretty compact and functinal rooms - love the walk-in shower with a huge shower head and enought room to jog around. The hotel's restaurant serves great food and the bar on the 32 floor serves great coktails and snacks until 2am, and the views from its ample terrace are very Hong Kong, i.e. breathtaking. The hotel also offers 24-hour room service - with a pretty good varied menu and I really enjoyed relaxing in their large 5-floor swimming pool. The Fitness centre is well equipped too, so all in all i've had a great stay both times and thouroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall package”
Reviews.Author: Jorg_D_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at EAST several times and it's got the full package: Great modern design, great and functional rooms, great views, great service, very affordable, amazing food @ Feast and a very cool and up-and-coming rooftop bar!

Reviews.Title: “Truly inspiring, innovative and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Creatto
Reviews.Content: As you can see from my list of reviews, I am now quite exposed to different types of acommodations, and without a doubt, East Hong Kong was one of the most pleasant surprises I have had in a while. The work comform has no match for this property. Its rooms are very welll designed, so the lack of space is compensated by a smart, chic, and very well achieved distribution and feel. The beds were very comfortable, and so was the ambiences that you could create with the well designed lighting system around the room. I found the conrollers near the bed very easy to understand, convenient to use and very practical. As soon as you enter the room (I was in one of the standard, harbour view bedrooms) you see a large closet that serves a double purpose of storing clothes, and also a hidden mini-bar. Then you see immediatly to your side a hall with your "integrated" bathroom, with the sink and vanity quite exposed, and then in two separate rooms, the toilet and the most amazing shower I have used in a while. Going straight, to the right, there was a long bench with 3 very convenient drawers for storing clothes and 1 containing a horizontal safe. then you see the office space, very conveniently setup, and above that, a frame that when you slide it, unveils a Panasonic HD television. Opposite to all that, was the King-size bed, with two convenient floodlights on top and two reading lamps on the side to set the right mood. To the side of the beds, are individual light controllers for the entire room, having a great "night" mode that turns on dicrete accent lights around the bed, the bed frame, the bathroom area and others. You can also turn all of the lights on creating a more bright environment. The room's front facing wall to the street are all HUGE windows, and you have a wonderful setting next to the bed that closes or open automatically shades that make the windows completely opaque for a good night sleep (perfect to adjust yourself to the time change). The restaurant was really good, the Sugar bar was chic, well priced and had a wonderful atmosphere and its Gym and pool were top nothc (although the equipment is not abundant, so expect delays specially in the mornings). For those of you business folks, the Internet connections and services on the hotel were great, fast and reliable. So all and all, this hotel surpassed my expectations, and I would totally recommend it. Some of the things I think are not so great about this property, is that it is far from where all happens, the good news is that the hotel sits on top of the Tai Koo station, so gtting in and out is not so hard. but the ride to Caseway Bay is like 10 minutes and to the rest of the main attractions in HKG Island, around 20 - 25 minutes commute. I have to say though that I liked this isolation for my time of retreat as it disconnected me from the business of the other areas of Hong Kong. I would say, give it a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Average - read why”
Reviews.Author: sfmattyb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at East for 2 weeks on a biz trip. Overall I rate the hotel average. Here's why. Location - Ok, but really depends on your situation. It's far from Central and TST. Hotel - Overall it's nice, modern, clean. Tries to be trendy. Rooms - Beds are very comfortable and I found the room to be very quiet. I was never disturbed by noise. The bathroom however, was bad. It's an open plan so there is no door and clear glass; so no privacy, unless you are in the toilet. (But ok if you are alone, I suppose) Wifi - good; strong signal and no connection problems Restaurant - food was average to good; service was consistently BAD. Nearly every time I ate there I had to ask the waitstaff 2-3 times for something, whether it was water, or my drink, or asking where my meal was. And that is if you could flag them down. Oftentimes, they barely understood English, which meant my order got messed up a few times. However they were very quick to make sure you signed your bill. Not acceptable for a business hotel. Sugar Bar - great views (if the sky is clear); however I invited outside friends to join me and they had difficulty getting into the bar. Apparently, it's a members-only thing unless you're staying at the hotel? I'd give it 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location!”
Reviews.Author: 428Globetrekker
Reviews.Content: The purpose for my trip to Hongkong was mainly shopping and enjoy nice food, so East Hotel was the perfect choice for me. The hotel is modern and room spacious with a very comfortable bed, and the rainforest shower is just wonderful. The only thing I miss is a nice couch. Even though it's a business hotel there should be more than just a chair by the desk. Checking in and out was very efficient, and the staff is young and dressed casual. But I felt like a little less important since I was not the average business customer in a way that I never got any smiles or "Good morning"s from the staff. The location is absolutely perfect for those who like shopping since the hotel is connected to Cityplaza - the biggest mall on Hongkong Island. There are plenty of shops and restaurants for western and eastern taste and also a large foodcourt. East may is a bit far from Central, but the metro is literally right beneath the hotel. Bad weather is not an issue since you can travel anywhere from Taikoo station without having to step outdoors. Had a room with cityview and that is looking straight into local residents livingrooms. Didn't bother me, but will try the harbour view next time. For those who like Chinese food - try Cafe de Coral just to the left when you enter Cityplaza from the hotel. Cheap and absolutely delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: MissMloves2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel for our 1 year anniversary and we were not disappointed. The harbour views from the upper floors are absolutely stunning, the rooms are nicely decorated and breakfast is wonderful. Waking up with the view of the harbour was mesmerizing. The hotel was very efficient, checkin and out were very fast and responded efficiently to any queries before and during our stay. The bar on the top floor has good cocktails. The MTR is almost inside the hotel and although it is about 20 minutes to the centre, it does not feel long. Connections to eg Stanley and Dragon's back hiking trail also very good. A special mention for the poached eggs at breakfast, they were the best eggs I've ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - Business Eco Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: singaporesaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the East Hotel for the 2nd time, it is a very convenient location, close to shops and also easy access to train lines. The king size bed rooms do not have a door for the showers, it is litterally a walk in showers and if you are not careful you may find yourself in full view of the neighbours watching you take a shower. The design of the hotel is to cater for people that are travelling on business and the hotel is economical and clean. Service is very prompt and efficient and food very reasonably priced. Visit the sugar bar on the 32 floor stunning views. Valule for money and I would visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Housekeeping Service”
Reviews.Author: iamd1
Reviews.Content: The room attendant was prompt in providing what I requested. I sensed his sincere effort in good service. I stayed with members of my family for several nights beginning July 17th. We were on the 26th floor and were so happy to have been the recipient of an excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “fresh, trendy hotel - with amazing harbour-views from the upper floors”
Reviews.Author: Christian O
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during a weekend-trip to Hongkong in january and had been thoroughly happy at the EAST ! Let me start out with the absolute highlight of the East Hotel: the views from the upper floors. we stayed at a Harbour-corner room on floor 26, and we were blessed to have great weather and great visibility during our stay. The views of the Kowloon Bay are absolutely sublime Hongkong is interessting to look at even from groundfloor-level ;-), but from the vantage-point of the Room at the East Hotel i couldnot help but stare out of the window just watching the scenery for minutes. the whole hotel is designed in a very pleasant modern and simplistic theme. it has a fresh and lively feel, not as dull and monotone as other hotels - we enjoyed the ambience there very much. the rooms are not too large as space is so precious in HK, but that doesnot affect the comfort of the room at all; first of all the room's layout and furnishings are very intelligently arranged, and of course the huge floor to ceiling windows have the whole room look our on Kowloon Bay providing an impression of generous spacing. the bed was very comfortable and the sleeping-comfort excellent. Also the details in the East's rooms are all great free (and fast !) Wireless Internet, nice gimmicks like an Ipod-docking-station and a Nespresso-machine with complimentary capsules staff was excellent: easy-going, provided attentive and friendly service quick at Check-in and Check-Out and arranging Taxis. food there is tasty too ! All-in-All: if one does not mind the location which is a little bit "out there" this is a GREAT ALTERNATIVE to 5-star hotels more in the center, for a relatively good value Highly recomended ! and i will be back to the East hopefully sooner than later

Reviews.Title: “Modern without soul without service”
Reviews.Author: Siom T
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks modern with latest apple checkin and trendy decor but the reality is that it is cold, inefficient and wearing badly. My checkin was horrible - supposedly seamless with their electronic system - but they were busy and it took 30 minute to get to my room - after a long flight you don't need this. I found the bell boys aloof. The front desk over occupied by their computer screens to observe. The room was looking tired - cupboards wouldn't close nicely, bathroom a bit worn. Hotel was very very busy and noisy and hectic - ok if you like hustle bustle. Breakfast room was bursting at the seams. Air conditioning was hard and blows just above your bed. I won't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Neil3Shanghai
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel--everything was wonderful --Jennifer and her team do a great job--lifestyle hotel with great views and quality food and beverage facilities ---will be back very soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy chic hotel in a CBD area”
Reviews.Author: luminouzity
Reviews.Content: Booked Urban View but when I checked in I got upgraded to Harbor View on the 30th floor. Was extremely and pleasantly surprised with the view from the room when I opened my door. Really amazing view. Interior of the room is very nice and chic, as well as the interior of the hotel. Something that you expect from Swire's hotel. Nice and comfortable bed. The rooftop bar is very cool as well. If you don't stay here, at least go to the rooftop bar. Breakfast was nothing special but still good. Was a bit sad had to check out from it after one night only stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & zen-type biz hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frog_Singap
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice there in July, 8th and 17th floor. Having corner room and floor to ceiling windows is useless considering how close the other buildings are, this is the most disappointing point. Room is not big, no sofa, but enough space around the bed, and the bathroom is interestingly designed, floor to ceiling glass panels right beind the bed...but again, better put the blinds down to avoid giving a strip tease to the neighbours. For me, my office being in Cityplaza, this hotel cannot be beaten in terms of location. Although at night, not much happening in the hotel food-wise and in the immediate neighborhood. I understand the gym was under renovation, but for a 300-room hotel, 2 treadmills only super turn off.

Reviews.Title: “East is east”
Reviews.Author: Asiatraveller02
Reviews.Content: Lucky me. On my first trip to Hong Kong I got to stay at the East Hong Kong. A young man dressed like the love child of Muji and the Communist Youth League opened the car door and immediately told the driver off for overcharging me for the journey from the airport. I wasn't even sure he was part of the hotel staff. The staff don't wear name badges but they are everywhere. Discreet, ubiquitous, caring and efficient, the hotel blends into them. I had a corner room on one of the top floors. The design is sleek, from the flat screen hidden behind a sliding wall, to the black marble sinks to the luxurious stationery set. This is Hong Kong, so the rooms are compact. Rooms at the East make the most of the space, giving you all the usual double room fixtures with still enough room to not feel enclosed. The breakfast buffet has a great choice. The fresh juices in handy bottles are a highlight. I never managed to finish the cooked breakfast. Excellent service, comfortable and relaxing rooms, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: dmagg
Reviews.Content: East is a modern hotel situated about 15 - 20 minutes by MTR from Central and Causeway Bay but don't let that discourage you. The rooms are very well appointed with adaptors and even an iPod with different playlists. I can't say enough about the rainshower. It was fantastic! I would highly recommend reserving one of the harbourview rooms as the view out of the floor to ceiling windows is breathtaking. Both Sugar and Feast had great food and the staff were very attentive. It was very handy to have such a huge mall adjacent to the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and chic hotel in a family-oriented location, weird feel but nonetheless nice”
Reviews.Author: Sal the Fat Fish
Reviews.Content: If you do not mind the location of this hotel far away from the business centre of Hong Kong, you will like the East Hong Kong. While nothing spectacularly mind-blowing, the East does give very good vibes and many things were in order, except for some small matters. I do have meetings at Quarry Bay (one station away) and I met an old client for a very good dinner at nearby Soho East, and employees of one of my most important Hong Kong clients have rented apartments within walking distance from the East. So in more ways than one, the location of this hotel can't be beat. Yes, I also had meetings at Wan Chai, Central and Kowloon and the distance from the East is significant, but the MTR station right at the door step of the hotel mitigates this aspect. Within 20 minutes, you're zipped to Central or Admiralty, and slightly more with a change of MTR line, you're in downtown Tsimshatsui or even further up north at Mongkok or Yau Ma Tei. What's weird about this hotel's location is that it's actually amidst a residential area. Unless you're out by the early hours of the day and back only late in the night, you cannot help but see the "family-ness" of this area. Around 10 am, there are many mothers and maids bringing kids to school, and by the early afternoon, many old folks congregate at the nearby shopping mall for lunch or simply watch their grandchildren gobble down the burgers from McDonald's. By the early evening, you see many teenagers in school uniform gallivanting with friends or enjoying a popsicle in the hot summer weather. So the East, being avant garde in design and trendy in attracting the hip and fashionable, especially to its Sugar bar at the roof-top, is very much sticking out like a sore thumb in this Tai Koo Shing location. Not that I was doing anything un-family, but the feel within and just outside the hotel is just so different I sometimes forget I am on a business trip; the Sunday afternoon I arrived, I thought of my mother asking me for lunch at her flat which could be just like any one of those nearby! As mentioned earlier, this hotel is some distance from the main business centre of Hong Kong, about 6 MTR stations away to be exact, if you consider Causeway Bay as part of the commercial centre of Hong Kong. The morning crowd on the MTR can be maddening, but somewhat mitigated by the politeness and graciousness of most Hong Kongers commuting on this mode of public transport. Shopping at next-door City Plaza is very much geared towards the family, and for that matter the upper-class families of Hong Kong. Things aren't cheap in this Asian city and it shows here at City Plaza, or the nearby Jusco hypermart on the other end of the MTR station's exit. Unlike Wan Chai, Causeway Bay or TST, you also do not have too many food choices if you want a late-night snack and there's no nightlife to talk about. If that bothers you, you need to know all this family-ness of this part of Hong Kong. The hotel itself is well designed in a minimalistic way. Hues of orange and grey punctuate the lobby, which gives a clean and slick look, without much of a clutter. I do not like the metallic-looking stairs leading up to the mezzanine floor which is the (only) restaurant of the hotel, reminds me of the Terminator look which is too industrial to me. The rooms are perhaps the best part of this outfit. It's compact but does not give the claustrophic feeling, something many hotel rooms in land-scarce Hong Kong do. The design and use of space is very intelligent, and I was told that it's by one of the top designers in this part of the world, Andre Fu. Not that I am au fait with this designer, but I do think the design of the East's room shows how talented he is and how much he understands the pecularity of the locality he's handling. I had the honour of staying in a harbour-view room, and although nothing like the views of tall office buildings in Kowloon or Central I had in earlier stays in more central locations of this city, they were welcoming and nice nonethless. The proximity to the many residential buildings at Tai Koo Shing means that some of the lower-floor rooms will definitely get to see the going-ons in some of Hong Kong's families and no real view to talk about. Amenities-wise, the East's rooms are adequate, except for the strange fact that there is no shoe horn in the room, even on request. This hotel is no budget option and although I do not think they profess to be 5-star, they do have many 5-star facilities such as a highly-comfortable rain shower, well-stocked mini-bar, high-end toiletries and most of the vanities you can imagine for use. Without a shoe horn does not seem right here, especially since I insist on wearing my boots using one. This hotel does however profess to be green and no printed bill is given when you check out. It's presented to you on an iPad-like screen before you at reception and then you check and sign on the screen. Of course, if you like it to be printed, you can still choose to kill some trees. Otherwise, you can ask them to email you (they were supposed to have done so instantaneously but did so only after I emailed back 1 day to remind) a copy. Service-wise, there were some misses like what I mentioned about the shoe horn and the emailing of the bill. The concierge was also not fast enough in responding to your needs (I needed to wait more than 20 minutes for luggage help when I checked out) and the smiles and willingness to please are very much absent from the East, unlike those big-name 5-star hotels which I'd stayed in, such as the Shangri-La, the Ritz Carlton and the Peninsula. Granted the East should and cannot be compared with these hotels, so let's not split hairs here. Still, perhaps due to the dull uniform and staid design of this hotel, the East's staff gives a certain clinical coldness, nothing warm at all. They may wish to rectify this by being more enthusiastic in pleasing customers and also smiling broadly more and greeting guests more warmly. All in all, the East is an impressive hotel which delivers well, especially for the price I was paying. Some points were missed understandably but by and large, I think the East will be a good choice to stay, perhaps more for a family holiday rather than a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holiday_phreak
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, comfortable, and most importantly perfect for a business trip. However, the view was not as good as advertised on the hotel's web page, only if you stay on high floor (maybe 20th floor or above), else the view outside of the hotel was not so pleasant. I stayed on the 11th floor, the view was just close enough to view the opposite residential apartment. Overall, the stay was a wonderful one. One feedback, the hotel staff's uniform was not so impressive, too casual to differentiate if this is a hotel staff or just another hotel customer. The front desk staff is not elegantly dressed.

Reviews.Title: “the official choice was a nice one”
Reviews.Author: riitoo
Reviews.Content: I was booked in to the East by a colleague at work - since my APAC office is in the same complex - Cityplaza , Taikoo Shing, Hong Kong. I guess the rates I stayed on were preferential, corporate rates. Service at the check in desk was extremely efficient.I had a very well appointed room and was extremely comfortable. It was described as an urban view room - in other words - it faced the apartment blocks located behind the hotel - which I was not too thrilled with ! I would have had to pay a premium for a harbour facing room - which I did not want to make a fuss about - since it was an official trip. I did, however, request for an upgrade to a harbour view room which i did not get :(( One thing that disconcerted me - my room had floor to ceiling glass windows which allowed a huge number of houses an unrestricted view of me - unless I completely shut the blinds at night. More so since the attached washroom was an open one - with no door and and an almost complete glass wall ! Superb from a location perspective - I had to walk through the mall next door to my office - which took all of 5 minutes if I did not get distracted. Look forward to the magic of a harbour view next time !

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: RoundhayParker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in May 2012. It was nearly faultless I have to say. Firstly, it is about 10 seconds (literally) from the MTR station, it feels upmarket, cool and on-trend from when you walk in. The room, while having a naff view (14th floor) was cleverly designed, it had everything you need and a monsoon shower with hot powerful water. In this city, this is welcome! Also , had a large, comfy bed, floor to cieling windows, iron etc etc all in room. Also spent one evenign at the hotel roof terrace which was bang up my street; DJ playing good house tunes, upscale crowd, nice drinks, great views etc. If you like this scene you'll be suitably impressed. Next time I'm in town I will almost certainly stay here, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “My stay with the "East".”
Reviews.Author: Patrick N
Reviews.Content: I just flew back home from my short trip in Hong Kong a couple of days ago and the hotel that I stayed was the East Hotel. Here are some of my opinions that I would like to share in related to the hotel room. It did not impress me at all when I first stepped into my room which was located on the lower 8th floor with urban view. It means that not only there is no view but also no privacy if you do not have the electronic window blinds closed completely. The reason is that those people living so close by across the street can clearly spot you from outside their homes. I felt very uncomfortable during my entire trip and had to have it closed it immediately when getting into my room. No traditional "DO NOT DISTURB" door knob sign can be located. Instead, by pressing a button on the bed-side-table and as soon as a tiny red light comes on, no one will bother you from the outside of the room. Door bell is not reasonably loud enough to be alert of. In addition, the only sink that I used during my stay got stuck twice in a row without a clue. (I got someone have it fixed the first time but did not bother it the last day when I checked out the hotel) Plus the water from the sink can splash everywhere. Besides, if you do need to use the toilet, once the door stays open widely (it has to be pulled out), no one can make his way across from either side. I found out it is very weird that there are only 2 pieces of wall glasses being used (one is facing you directly inside the bathroom while the other one is standing side way in the toilet) for the entire room are in deep brown or burgundy. (still got question marks everywhere in my mind and been trying to figure it out.) The setting of the clock is not very practical - you have to get up in your bed and turn back in order to read the time with your lazy eyes. It is always a hassle to set the alarm clock unless you have the patience to go through those tons of steps or instructions. I-pod can never stand on its dock station securely unless you find something else to support it. Over all, I can only give my thumbs up to those friendly-used 37" LCD TV as well as those complimentary tea bags along with the espresso machine that can suit my needs. Services provided is just average. Since "MTR" is just right across the hotel's main entrance plus both shopping mall as well as a huge variety of foods are very easily available at "Cityplaza" and which is just a block away. If you are purely looking for convenience, it is highly recommended for you to stay at the "East"

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: eddy238
Reviews.Content: We did an Asia tour (Malaysia, Brunei, Singapore, Thailand, Macau, and Hong Kong) and the East Hotel in Hong Kong was definitely our favourite. When we first walked in the decor is very modern and the staff was super friendly (very good touch with the young/hip attire). We went to our room and it was amazing, the blinds are all electronically controlled so you can just set it all to go up and you get a great view (assuming that you get a Harbour View Room). The hotel is very close to Cityplaza and the MTR. The Sugar bar which was located on the 32nd floor of the hotel was just awesome. The breathtaking views is a must and even just going there alone will make your stay that much more enjoyable. The hotel was a bit far from Central Hong Kong but it’s not a problem at all because there is shopping around you and it’s not too far to get to Mong Kok and other desired places. Would definitely recommended and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best view whilst having a shower!”
Reviews.Author: Starfish13
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed being in a part of HK that I had never stayed in before. The area is mostly populated by locals however there is a great shopping centre (with H&M) right next door. There is also a MTR station right underneath so easy to get to Central or TST. Check in was seamless. Like others have said, the view from the 26th floor was absolutely phenomenal. Going to bed and waking up each morning facing the harbour was truly memorable. I loved the shower which had a glass window allowing you to look at Kowloon whilst being drenched by a rain water shower head. Little touches like iPod with music on it, laptop available on request if you need to book DHL for some reason, a lolly jar, in room travel adaptor, cords etc. I would recommend a harbour view room for sure. There was also a notepad next to the bed with puzzles to play if you're travelling alone or want to tune out for a while. Loved this. There is a restaurant on level 1 called Feast which makes surprisingly great lattes to go. If its your first time to HK I probably wouldn't recommend you stay here as it is a few stations out from where all the action is. Otherwise definately one to check out for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer services”
Reviews.Author: V P
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in this hotel, however, during my visit in HK back in Nov 2011, I went to the roof top lounge a few times. The courteous staffs always gave me very good impression, until I have the following incident, I have to say they have excellent customer services! The Hotel locates in a somewhat residential area from what I can see. Like many other HK attractions, it is very convenient as it has many different choices of public transportation. Even late at night, you can take the MTR which is only an escalator away, or the taxi stand always line up with taxis. The roof top lounge - Sugar, has an amazing view, particularly if you choose the outside seating. If you will go at night like I did, I highly recommend to bring an outerwear or a scarf with you. On the night before I return to the States, I spent an enjoyable night with my friends at Sugar again. While on the way back to the hotel that we stayed, my boyfriend realized he lost his iPhone. We immediately went back to East HK and planned to search for it. Unfortunately the lounge was already closed at this point. We then talked to the front desk hostess and explained the situation. She immediately escalated up to her manager, and he offered to bring us up to the lounge without hesitation. It was already 3 a.m. The manager also asked couple of other staffs to help searching but with no luck. They searched every possible places including the bathroom stalls, planters behind the seats, spaces underneath the sofas, flipped thru all the seat cushions etc. Sadly we left with empty hands at around 4:30 a.m. The manager asked for our contact info and promised if he would find it, he would call us. We then gave my HK friend's contact info to the manager. Coming back to the States with disappointment and ready to buy another phone, then my friend told me that she received a call from the East HK few days later and said the iPhone was found. Special thanks to the manager and the staffs who had helped us during that night. Although I forgot their names, I always appreciated their efforts and followed up. They took our matter seriously. Not that many people out there will treat the lost & found items like the way they did.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: LeaW01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Harbour View room on the 27th floor for 2 nights on 1 June and although a little expensive, was worth it for the views of Victoria Harbour. Room is very modern and quite spacious for HK standards. The bed was very comfortable and the Espresso coffee machine is a nice touch. Bathroom is open (although toilet is behind a frosted glass) so could be uncomfortable for some travellers. Entrance is right next to Tai Koo MTR exit and CityPlaza shopping mall with lots of shops, eateries and entertainment venues. I spent most of my time in Shek O visiting family, so the location was perfect for the MTR and bus connections. Sugar Bar on the 32nd floor is a nice spot for a drink with a large outdoor terrace to maximise the views - drinks aren't cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Slick hotel in different location”
Reviews.Author: Thefox_11
Reviews.Content: Modern, friendly hotel that has contemporary style and very good standard of room. Located next to shopping centre. A little out of the way for tourists, but good stay if you have business this side of the island. Very good restaurant within he hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in HK”
Reviews.Author: Lesley R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in HK, It delivers all it sets out to deliver. Helpful staff, good restaurant, great breakfast (how many hotels do that?), simple but good rooms great views whether of the harbour or internal... Its a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with good connections”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location next to the MTR. There is a shopping Center next door and an area with plenty of bars and restaurants. The hotel was very modern and the rooms looked great. While they had obviously had a lot of thought put into them some of it did not quite work. The bathroom has a clear mirror so I would not like to share the room. It also took me and my colleagues a while to find the do not disturb sign. It also lacked the normal book/folder found in most hotels with basics of the room and hotel facilities. Only ate at the hotel a quick dinner once but food and service was good. Bar on the roof is very swish. But strange to have to explain who you are meeting when you walk in. Felt like an interview. All in all a good hotel I would recomend for business in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Good Ambience, Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: himadrishekhar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel in HK on multiple occassions from Feb 2012 to April 2012. Pro's 1) Good Rooms - especially Harbour Facing Corner Rooms 2) Courteous and Helpful staff 3) Hotel Ambience 4) Restuarant 5) Proximity to the MTR and Cityplaza Cons 1) Room Service - Takes a long time for even simple request 2) Breakfast - Again long serving time 3) A tad expensive at times given the location

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bluet_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights back in April with a 2 month old and a 3 year old. The room was bright, spacious (by HK standards), and quiet. The walls must be well insulated because you can't hear a crying baby! I didn't care for the glass enclosed bathroom. I know it's modern, but a little more privacy would be nice, especially when turning on the light at night. The staff were always responsive, and perhaps a bit to anticipatory of your needs. The hallways could be a bit brighter. Next to the MTR and 720 bus that takes you right to Central in a matter of minutes. Connected to Cityplaza Mall which has basically everything you could need. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful fresh juice”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas076
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for business trip. All the necessary facilities in the room. No need to leave time outside, Feast restaurant is perfect for breakfast and in-room dining!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, great facilities, amazing ambience”
Reviews.Author: Ramya N
Reviews.Content: I was in HK for a business trip for a week while I stayed at this hotel. The nice relaxing rooms and facilities made my trip really easy and memorable. The bar on the 32nd is one of the best places to chill. Overall wonderful experience. Look forward to come back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent facilities, great restaurant, and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on a business trip. The staff were extraordinarily courteous and efficient. The rooms are modern, beautifully appointed, and have great views, at least on the bay side (be sure to ask for one). The bathrooms don't afford a lot of privacy though (no door to bathroom, glass door for shower, etc.). The continental breakfast was phenomenal. The location is less than ideal. It's close to one large mall but few restaurants or shopping areas. The metro system is so good though, that you're just 10-15 minutes from lots of tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Buisness like”
Reviews.Author: adrian w
Reviews.Content: Having been moved to EAST after our Hotel- Harbour Grand caught fire,we were a bit worried our travel rep was moving us to a cheap hotel, fears completly gone. This is a modern hotel with well designed rooms, its a pity the views are into peoples flats,Don't know if its one way glass ,just in case keep covered up if blinds are up. The SUGAR BAR on the top of the Hotel is wonderful with out side terrace,and views across harbour, its a little way out of he city ,so don't expect the iconic views. Only having breakfat here,you have the choice of continental or full breakfast,which has a various choice from menu.Although the coffee service is slow, why can't they carry coffee pots,they take your cup and disappear for such a long time. The staff dress caual and if you can't tell whos staff look at their feet they wear plimsole type shoes.Its right by the MTR station and theres a walkway conecting hotel to CityPlaza shopping mall.More a business persons hotel than a family one, but were a couple and its OK for us ,it ticks our boxes.They even have IT department that helped me out when i had computer trouble.Nothing is to much trouble it rates above our previous hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlani
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here. Originally it was only for 4 nights, we booked the standard city-view room. They were so nice to upgrade it to corner city-view room for our honeymoon, and also provided us with wine and cookies in the room. The room itself was soooo spacious, very trendy, and clean with Elemis toiletries. Unfortunately the view was overlooking to the apartment across the street, so wasn't comfortable to open the blind We extended our stay and decided to get the harbour-view instead. We should have done this earlier. The view was fantastic, especially at night! Location is really good, MTR and CityPlaza shopping center are just next door. It's around 15 min to Central HK though, but it wasn't a problem for us as we had great value already. Too bad we were unable to try the outdoor swimming pool as it was raining. However, the Sugar Bar at the top level is highly recommended. The view is just amazing.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: barneybanana
Reviews.Content: I was in Hong Kong for a business trip and East was right next door to my office, so for me the location was perfect (it's otherwise a 15 min train ride to Central HK). With the Citiplaza shopping centre and the Tai Koo MTR station attached to the hotel, the hotel is well serviced. The rooms are contemporary, comfortable bed and really good shower, with lots of hot water - perfect for me. A bonus is the free wifi. There is also a gym and outdoor pool, but I am not used them. There is a restaurant downstairs and a bar on the top floor. I thought the food was alright, but nothing extra-ordinary. My taxi drvier did not know how to find the hotel, but once I called the hotel reception, they were happy to give directions to the taxi driver. Overall, the staff is very nice, helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mikiduta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days between 30.12 - 01.01.12. We decided that after a Christmas in Thailand to spend The New Year in The Ultra Modern Hong Kong. After a night spent in the airport of Phuket and in the air with Hong Kong Airlines we arrived at the hotel around 9 am and the receptionists were very nice and give us the room before check-in hour. We had a harbour view room (2601) at 26th floor and the views are breathtaking. The hotel is very close to Taikoo Metro Station so it is very easy to get to any part of the city even if the trip will take some while. The hotel is very clean, the bed is very comfortable, plenty of room for luggage even if it is known that HK hotels have very small rooms. Wifi Internet is free, you have ipad dock station, LCD Tv, good ventilation and modern shower. The hotel is very quiet and we were during one of the busiest periods of the year. We did not buy the breakfast because it was very expensive 180 hkd / pers and we ate in the mall that is connected to the hotel. Even the lunch is very cheap in the selfservice restaurant from the mall. We paid for a soup and a steak with rice 80 hkd. Unbelievable. My girlfriend was so fond of the hotel room that in our last day she did not want to leave the room... I recommend the hotel to all the people which love nice views, silence and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: rjohns13
Reviews.Content: Very convenient wireless everywhere for multiple connections, decent food but not the best but still good, comfortable rooms, try to get a harbor view room. Stayed two weeks, service level held the entire time. Clean rooms. Gym is being worked on so only two tread mills, one elliptical but the management told us that at check in. Very nice pool outside. Staff attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Funky”
Reviews.Author: Colin L
Reviews.Content: Stay at the East when I was in Hong Kong. Conveniently located at Tai Koo Shing and right next to Citiplaza. When I got off the cab from the airport, a guy in very casual outfit came up to the cab and started to take my luggage from the trunk. When I saw this, my panic button was activated. I thought I was getting mugged until I realized that it was the staff from the hotel. ;-) ;-) The lobby was minimalist, functional and really nice. The room was very nice and well appointed. I had a room with the "Urban View". What this means is that I could see into the apartments across the road. Hang on, if I can see them, it means the they also can see me. Had the blinds all the time I was there. My normal practice when I first check in to unpack and press the clothes that I need for the next few days.Located the iron and ironing board but when I extended the iron board, I realized that it came up about 6 inches above my knees. Started to press my clothes whilst kneeling but that did not last long. Eventually completed my pressing whilst sitting down on the chair. Order room service one night and was rather surprised that it came in a "doggy bag". Every was disposable and recyclable. Nice touch but a bit strange. Overall, a very pleasant stay and will definitely go back there whan I am next back in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with excellent harbour view”
Reviews.Author: HelloMister
Reviews.Content: Stayed at East Hotel for a week. Modern hotel with excellent harbour view. Love the gym. The location is great and it's right beside Tai Koo Shing and the MTR station. The only downside was the lack of service at times. There were a few occasions where our hands were full of luggage bags but no one came over to open the door for us even though there were staff members standing around nearby. Not expecting Four Seasons service but common courtesy would have been appreciated. All in all a great hotel and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, no so great views”
Reviews.Author: MattP_UK
Reviews.Content: Second stay here. Great location for our offices, great service, clean and good rooms. Only downside is the urban rooms look directly on to lots of apartments, addd to the fact the shower has a glass front, be sure to close the blinds! Rooms are compact but functional.

Reviews.Title: “One of few bargain Hotels in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Rosi-Alexander
Reviews.Content: we stayed at EAST for the first time and very much enjoyed our stay. the Hotel is located in Tai Koo in the east of Hong Kong, which is mainly a residential area, so there are only a few restaurants and no bars around the hotel. the hotel only opened about two years ago, so everything is new and kept in good shape. rooms are modern and comfortable with a open shower. i recommend to take a harbour corner room which is slightly larger than the normal rooms. Rooms on the high floors offer a lovely view over the harbour. Nice modern bar called SUGAR on the 32nd floor. Very good breakfast. There is direct access to Tai Koo MTR station. From there it's about 20 Mins by MTR or Taxi to Central and 30 Mins to Kowloon. At prices around HK$ 2000 per night this hotel is highly recommended if you don't need/want to stay in the city Center. We used to stay at the Sheraton (tsim sha shui) in the past but EAST is a far better choice at 1/3 of the price.

Reviews.Title: “East HK - a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: doyleb
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a stay at the East from 26 Mar – 5 April. As a point of reference I travel to HK and throughout the US regularly. My last stay in HK was at the Conrad. The East is very close to my company’s main processing office in CityPlaza 4, hence the stay there as opposed to Pacific Place. In summary – the East is a good business hotel. The rooms are somewhat small, but serviceable. The storage space is limited – especially for a 12 day stay, but for 1 – 5 night it’s no problem. The bath area takes some getting used to – it is an open concept, but the shower area is nice with very good water pressure and all the necessary amenities provided. The bed was very comfortable and even on the 14th floor, I was not bothered by street noise. The rolling window shades provided plenty of light blocking. The room is modern in its decorations – not over the top but the hardwood floors with carpeting around the bed with some modern art on the walls worked for me. The room was bright enough and I never had an issue working there. I found the staff to be very friendly and always willing to be of service, from the front-desk to the restaurant staff to the attendants in the gym / pool area. Sugar on the top floor is the lounge and it is very nice if the weather cooperates for a late night drink with a view of the harbor. The snack menu there is limited but tasty. Feast is the only hotel restaurant on the 1/F – the breakfast buffet is reasonable with a selection of fruit, pastries / breads, juices, yogurts and muesli / cereals. Hot entries can be ordered for breakfast. The coffee service seemed a bit slow and I changed to tea after 2 days as it usually took 5 minutes to individually brew another cup of coffee when mine ran out. I only had lunch there once and it was crowded, so I assume the selection was good. Due to late night business, calls I did order room service 3 times – the food was delivered on time and correctly. The gym area is reasonably small, but they seem to have enough equipment. The pool deck is quite large with nice loungers to relax in. Overall I had a good experience there - the hotel is clean, nicely decorated, basically comfortable if not utilitarian, and the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is a bit inconvenient if you want to spend most of your time in Central / Wan Chai / Causeway Bay, but getting into / out of the MTR is very easy. There are plenty of shops and grocery stores (Apita and Sogo) nearby if you’re interested in buying your own meals / snacks. I’d recommend this hotel for business travelers who need to stay in the area and solo travelers or couples, but not for families due to the room sizes.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot9193
Reviews.Content: My husband, two daughters and I stayed here during the last week of March since we were in town for a wedding. It was a fabulous experience. Some of things we enjoyed most: spotless harbor view rooms, the rainfall shower complete with Elemis spa toiletries, comfortable bed, well designed storage space with room safe, prompt laundry service, amazing breakfast buffet, lovely pool, organized run at 6:30 am, state of the art gym equipment, next to the MTR station, and adjacent to large shopping mall. We liked the overall hotel ambience and modern decor. However, what makes a hotel is it's staff. Staffers can easily be spotted in black Converse shoes. All were very helpful for anything from exchanging money to finding restaurants and services. Their significant efforts towards sustainability with the paperless systems for check in, etc align well with our lifestyle. We will definitely stay at The East on our next stay in Hong Kong and recommend that you do as well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and make you feel happy”
Reviews.Author: alaaandyenzhi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife and in Law, I enjoyed this hotel , breakfast was excellent and the staff are friendly and want to help.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Business Hotel alas lacking any individuality or warmth...”
Reviews.Author: buntyt33
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the first part of our Far East stay as we liked the modern, stylish design and that is was away from all the mayhem of the harbour area but had excellent transport links. (And being a business class hotel likely to be less children running around - just a persoanl preference!). Getting the MTR (Metro) to and from the centre of town was a breeze and like all public transport in HK was cheap, clean & reliable. The station was right next to the hotel and the journey was about 15 minutes, Check in was slick with ipads replacing the good old pen & paper but not particularly welcoming - I think efficient sums it up. It set the tone for the rest of the trip. The rooms were spotless with some nice touches and while many contributors have commented on the rooms use of glass in the bathroom area we did not find it much of a problem but it could be if you were on a first weekend away! A comfy bed was always welcome after a day of humid sight-seeing! The pool was freezing cold (I liked!) and if you don't like being overlooked (See pic!) best to avoid. There was alot of building work going on around; it is a mainly residential area so not the nmost relaxing without an ipod or such! After one particulalry exhausting day we ordered room service and I am sorry to say both mine and my other half's was quite inedible; the best thing about it was the packaging it arrived in!! Maybe 6 nights was too long to stay here and while I am glad we did try it we would be in no hurry to return...There are after all many other great hotels in HK to try!

Reviews.Title: “Eastern Delight”
Reviews.Author: Seandelear
Reviews.Content: Having done the research for a hotel in Hong Kong and rejecting all others I was apprehensive when I arrived. I need not have been. This is a modern hotel with reasonable sized rooms especially for Hong Kong. I had read that some reviewers had problems with its location. Apart from the fact that taxi fares are very cheap in HK compared with US and European cities of comparable size, there is an excellent metro system which runs until 01.00 and is fast, clean and safe, not to mention the little publicised virtually non-stop bus service which is almost as quick if not quicker than the metro. So have no fears about the location. The staff ( with one small exception ) were ultra polite and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The restaurant for breakfast is a little expensive but the choice and availability of the buffet breakfast meant we ate three on 3 of our 8 days stay. The rooms are ultra modern and again I read of some complaints about the technology but unless you have the mental incapacity of a tabloid journalist or senior bank official the normal person should have no difficulty. The one small fault I had with the hotel ( although it would not stop me staying there on my next visit to Hong Kong) was the rooftop bar. The view is superb, the drinks choice wide but I found the opening hours very restrictive , especially on a Sunday Evening. The staff did not seem to be that interested in our party despite the fact that we were staying in the hotel for 8 nights and I detected a certain coolness as if somebody of my age ( accelerating towards 60) did not fit in with their idea of a client of the bar. That aside I would have no hesitation in staying there again and have already recommended ther Hotel to friends .

Reviews.Title: “Good value, different experience from other hotels in town”
Reviews.Author: Frankieandcharl
Reviews.Content: Located close to the City Plaza Mall relatively far from the centre of H-K Island or Kowloon, this is a hotel you might be excused not to have spotted. I go there on business from time to time. i found it surprisingly good value, and quite different from other hotels in town. with a decor I can qualify of "trendy chic" (lounge music in the lifts...) and a young service oriented staff, it is a good place to stay in this part of town at a relatively good value price tag. you can see it is a successful make over from an older building. The views are OK (but some council block-like building at the front sadly do not make some views at sea the most pleasant). While not cheap the hotel pick-up from the airport is a treat. Rooms are smallish but comfortable. Nice top terrace with superb views at the top for drinks and corporate events.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: MWTrvler
Reviews.Content: Had an overall great stay for business trip in Oct/Nov 2011. The room was very modern and comfortable to return to after a long day in the office.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, excellent view”
Reviews.Author: yonaga
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nites. The room is very modern. Bed is heavenly, must be the best sleep I ever had. There is an iPod with iHome speaker, not many nice songs tho but there's an apps to check you bills and other info, nice touch. The view from the room is exquisite, if the sky is clear. Unfortunately, during my stay, it was hazy and misty most of the time. The shower is great and toiletries provided is of very good quality. Restaurant is OK. It is just that, after 4 days, I got tired of everything as there's not much to choose from. As for location, it is just perfect. MTR station is just a few steps away and there's a shopping complex next door. All in all, enjoyed the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Service, Great Room Interior and Strategic Location”
Reviews.Author: Gim Hoe K
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff upgraded my room to Suite in my very first stay. The room interior was very modern and come with very comfortable bed. It is located right at the MTR exit and next to shopping mall. However, I have a little dissapointment when breakfast at the cafe/restaurant. The staffs were nice but the service was a little slow to me. Generally I find the staffs here were attentive except at the cafe/restaurant and guess it was probably due to the shortage of manpower. Overall experiece was great and deifnitely will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say, it was great!”
Reviews.Author: eastsidehirise
Reviews.Content: I booked my 5-day stay at EAST mainly because of the reviews and photos I read here in TripAdvisor, as well as a look at the hotel website... and I got what I was expecting! The location is not in central Hong Kong, but is situated next to the Tai Koo subway line as well as a large shopping centre, CityPlaza, which has a busy food court, restaurants, cinemas, as well as branches of most of the major retail brands you will find across Hong Kong... there is even a large MUJI at street level which always has interesting stuff. My point is that you can stay at EAST and still have a comprehensive shopping and dining experience in the local area. In terms of safety it is a clean and safe neighbourhood. The hotel design is very modern, which was great! The modern design sensibility of the lobby and public spaces is extended to the rooms, which are also very modern. It is true that the standard guest rooms adopt an open-plan attitude towards differentiating between the bedroom and the bathroom, but the materials and hardware used is top-notch, so I don't mind to use EAST's approach to room layout because it is so well-executed. I loved the rainshower, the extensive suite of electrical controls of manipulating room lights and blackout shades, large LCD tv with a great compliment of local and international channels, and comfy bed! I tried the in-room dining, and its true, keeping in the hotel's spirit of environmental sustainability, the in-room dining is delivered in biodegradable packaging and recyclable cutlery... one would think it would reduce the cost of room service, but apparently not... What can I say about the staff... good enough. Yes, they are dressed in casual attire in the style popularized by Apple. But like any large hotel, you will find average service by average staff. Some of the staff were particularly nice and polite, others were not really any better than what I would expect in a 2 or 3 star establishment. But I didn't really care, because my hotel room was so good! In short, you should stay at EAST if you are looking for a modern, well-appointed hotel to stay at. I enjoyed my stay very much and definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way excellence”
Reviews.Author: Robert A
Reviews.Content: Being in the East of Hong Kong Island, this Hotel is a little "out of the way" in terms of serious shopping. But, it is a gem! A modern, young & vibrant, chic Hotel that has everything you will ever need. The Harbor view rooms are amazing and the whole experience was great. It is above the Tai Koo MTR, which is a long way east of anything, but there is a "secondary" shopping community here. From coffee shops to Label stores and even a "Western" supermaket for you all your imported goods. The Hotel staff were amazingly efficient and polite and the breakfast was an interesting mix of A La Carte (for hot food) and Buffet (for cold food) - certainly not your traditional hotel buffet breakfast but excellent all the same. I have stayed there twice and ready for the third visit. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, off the beaten track. Great for business and leisure.”
Reviews.Author: Matthijs2517
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the hotel with my son (4.5 yrs old) and had a great time. The only observation (not a complaint!) is lack of a kids channel in the room. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to be friendly to my son. The hotel is clean and well maintained, near all facilities and the distance to Central is doable and there's more to Hong Kong then Central. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Job EAST !”
Reviews.Author: Jeje175
Reviews.Content: I am an hotelier in South Asia and I travel often for business. I decided to stay at EAST last week and I have to say it was the right choice. Although I dont like very much the area where it is located, the nearby MTR makes everything so easy and it is not a problem to be a bit far away from everything. Stunning views (ask for a high floor), rooms are very small but great. Free Wifi (so rare and so important!) , very nice and helpful staff, I loved the Sugar bar on the last floor and lunch (buffet) at their restaurant was affordable and truly good. Well done EAST ! I will be back ! Keep the rates as it is please!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business in HK”
Reviews.Author: JC64Madeira
Reviews.Content: Convenientlt located in the business district, connected to mall and many office buildings as well as the tub station. Sleek and contemporary design, rooms featuring all necessary amenities including coffee machine and iron; young and very efficient staff dressed in trendy grey suit- white shirt- no tie- black Converse. Value for money cold buffet lunch in 1st floor. Choose room with harbour views and don't miss a late drink on top floor, with great ambience. Last but not least free Wifi throughout the property working on all your devices!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel East not a bad choice but beware of booking agent”
Reviews.Author: chungmayo08
Reviews.Content: I have booked a city escape night at 31.12.2011 to avoid crossing harbour after new year eve celebration. I booked a room (standard urban) here and after checking the rate posted in their original web site approx HK 1500 or US 180 without breakfast. I wander into Hotels.com but may be because of the smartphone default language, I was redirected into their Taiwan website. The trap is there, after checking the price and go to confirmation page, the amout of 550 dollars appear. Only in the fine print that it is stated in US dollars. I mistaken it as HK dollars. I did not book it the first time. I give the hotel a call and they reply a rack rate of HK2200 including breakfast. I go back again to the Hotels.com page and find the price to be NT dollars 3000 (But later the web site deny such post and insist it is higher) and I commit my credit card for the booking, it turn out again to be 550 dollars (only in the small print that it is said to be in US dolloars). I booked it and had a so so experience of usual business hotel setting without breakfast.After I found out the credit card bill to be US 550 which is HK 4500.I make a comment and get into no where. The excuse from the Hotels.com site is that it is their policy in charging in US dollars. Only that the customer mistaken it. Fine, I also mistaken that the third party can charge a room at US 180 rack rate and brand it as a bargain offer that cost US 550. It is just not a fair but outrageous mark up for a hotel room in outskirt residential area and charge at six star price. All I want is to enquire them that the post of NT 3000 or even NT 30000 is their fancy asking price and to see if any fool like me will fall into this trap. As I confirm the credit payment of 550 dollars (alas in US and not in HK dollars), I can blame nobody but myself to pay an extravagant price just to save the traffic inconvenience of my night outing. the Hotel East has nothing to do with my dissatisfaction but beware of the internet booking procedure if you consider booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: 10RatsRock
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the north part of HK. Rooms are a little small, but very nice. Style is modern and sleek. Loved the overhead shower. Bed was very comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful. Try the bar on the top floor. Great Views.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms - but nothing outstanding about the place”
Reviews.Author: Travelexpertdotcom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little off the beaten track from the hub and sights of Hong Kong, but if you're willing to travel (and get a cheap price), it's not a bad place to stay. The rooms are ok - but if you're staying on any floor lower than the 20th, you'll be looking into all your high-rise neighbours apartments, and they look STRAIGHT into yours! There is absolutely no privacy in the lower rooms. Rooms higher up are nice, but watch-out as the hotel try to charge you more for these. They do offer them to some people for free though, so push your luck! The services in the hotel are poor. No meeting rooms. The restaurant often gets fully booked early (even for hotel guests), and the bar doesn't open until 6pm. But the rooftop bar is a nice place to hang out on an evening - though given the choice, you're better off heading into the heart of Hong Kong for a better (and cheaper) night out. In short, it's clean and tidy - but nothing out of the ordinary. If you get a cheap deal (and a high up room) then it's worth staying this far out of Hong Kong's heartland.

Reviews.Title: “This is an Outstanding Business Hotel for Solo Travellers!!”
Reviews.Author: Cornucopia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at East for four nights in November 2011, at the beginning of a round the world holiday. We were attracted by the position in a quieter part of Hong Kong island, the ultra modern design, clean lines, light airy rooms, reasonable prices but mostly the high rating this hotel achieves in Trip Advisor (and other sites too!!). It was an easy transit from Chek Lap Kok Airport via the city express train and then the subway (from Central) to Tai Koo on the western end of the island where the East Hotel is. The hotel is actually right beside the eastern entry to Tai Koo subway station which was sooo convenient!! Unfortunately we arrived way too early to check in at about 10 am (the hotel was apparently fully booked) so we went off sightseeing for the day. When we returned at about 2:30 the room was ready and we moved in. Shock! The room is really suitable for just one person! A king bed OK, but just a single chair to sit on and this is an office chair at the desk! The room is small by world traveller standards. There is no bathroom as such, just a partition across the room from which the shower and toilet open and both have glass doors. Absolutely no privacy. And a single bathrobe (message there!!). On request we were given a second bathrobe and another (kitchen) chair... In fairness, on revisting both the Hotel's site and the reviews it became obvious that it was a hotel DESIGNED for single business travellers, it had been made quite clear and this was our oversight. Blinded by the light perhaps... On the positive side, the place was scrupulously clean, the view over the western end of Hong Kong Harbour was to die for, the maid service was impeccable and the breakfast (inclusive in our tariff) was world class. Also, all the staff were most welcoming, courteous, helpful and, well, just professional. So we do recommend a stay at East....alone!! And go in the winter when it's so easy and comfortable to get around without Hong Kong's notorious heat and humidity...

Reviews.Title: “A mistake made by the travel agency”
Reviews.Author: hnkong
Reviews.Content: I reserved a guest room during the Chinese New Year via Hotel.com.hk but unfortunately the travel agency mistakenly wrote an incorrect check-in date. When I came to the front desk at the Hotel, I was told that there were no booking under my name. However, the East team were very patient and helped seek out the problem for me. I think in terms of hardware, East Hong Kong is as good as the other five to six-star hotels in town. But in terms of software, I believe the service quality of your team is excellent. From the perspective of a guest, this is the only reason to re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super new, shiny, chic hotel... decent price but not cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Red_Three
Reviews.Content: For my girlfriends first trip to HK we decided to spend a little more on a nice hotel and EAST certainly didn't disappoint. Its location in tai koo may feel further out than some would like, but being situated practically on top of tai koo station with a taxi rank just 100yards from the entrance, transport links are excellent. Tai koo is on the blue MTR Island line- so is super convenient for reaching cenntral, wan chai or causeway bay. The hotel itself is also directly opposite the new tai koo shopping mall- so if you're feeling lazy you can hop over for some quick food or shopping. As soon as you step through the large double high doors you can't help but be impressed by their large 3 storey high lobby, which is a classy glass and steel affair. Theres an execllent rooftop bar with amazing views as well as a well equipped gym + outdoor pool ( unfortunately i didn't have the time to use these) We got the room 1 grade above standard. I was pleased by the high ceilings, modern design + all the gadgets! Its nice and bright due to one side of the room being essentially one massive window with motorised blinds. Flatscreen tv as standard with free WIFI (although i had some problems with my connection). They also have a ipod speaker alarm clock with a ipod touch for your use. This was a pleasant surprise as normally most hotels just provide the dock. The ipod touch lets you select music from the hotels library as well as browse the hotels facilities- strangely though you can't use it to browse the web. The room seems deceptively bright + spacious probably because of the "open plan" style of the bathroom which is divided from the bedroom by a thin glass panel. I liked our walk in wet room with rain shower. However my girlfriend did not like the toilet which has a frosted glass door- possibly a bit too intimate for some people. Service was great, the staff were polite, helpful + friendly. I only gave it 3 stars for value, because for £130 a night- although the hotel was certainly worth it- i'd be hard pressed to say that it was a bargain. I'd happily stay here again, all in all this is a great place for a young couple to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amit511
Reviews.Content: You would be surprised to see how much they can accommodate in a small space and how it still feels big enough even for stays that might be prolonged beyond couple of weeks. The hotel has all the modern facilities and if you happen to occupy one of the top floors facing harbor front, you would feel like being in a space station. The Hotel is equipped with complementary Wi-Fi and Gymnasium but if you need any other facility they would arrange it for you. Its well connected and has huge mall right next to it.. I stayed there for over 2 weeks and didnt have a single reason to complain....

Reviews.Title: “Feels far out but it really is not...”
Reviews.Author: jaye_w
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is right next to the TaikooShin MTR exit D. Though it's a little far east on HK Island ( as suggested by the name of the hotel) we found the distance managable and comfortable to all the sights we needed to go. (except the Western District) Room was very modern and chic. Bed was comfortable and the free wi-fi and printing was a bonus. If there was 1 improvement to be suggest, it would be the sinks as the sink was too shallow so the area around the wash basin was often wet. Bathroom is showing some wear but nothing shabby. Nice bath amenities with soap and shampoo that is actually good for your skin. The airport bus(A10) stops right outside the mall which is next to the hotel. The mall is handy for last-minute shopping as all the major brands ( including H&M and Agnes B) are represented. We may have been lucky as it was the weekend but we checked-in around 8am and were given clean rooms immediately. =) Def. will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab business hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcsmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for business and was delighted! Staff was great, amenities in room made everything pleasant and easy- free wifi, adaptor at the ready, etc. Gym was nice. Front desk staff were exceptionally pleasant and capable. Location was perfect for me - could walk through the mall next door or hop a train to anywhere. Would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not as cool as they'd like you to believe”
Reviews.Author: lmitravel
Reviews.Content: Everything about EAST seems really cool, until you get here. No, it's not bad - it's just average. Yes, it is a bit cheaper than a lot of hotels in Central, and EAST would have you believe that it's ONLY because you're a bit out of the way and not because their amenities are less nice. Well, the rooms are starting to get worn out, furniture looks cheap and odd things here and there look like they could use some polishing or better maintenance. As for the views - only if you're on a high floor and the skies are extra clear. We were in a corner harbour view room on 19th floor - a pretty nice setup at this hotel - but as the days were hazy, all we could see clearly were peoples' apartment windows all around us. And I hear HK has a lot of hazy days, not least of all due to pollution. So don't count on views by any means. Very expensive restaurant - we chose to eat all our meals out. Next time, I would definitely stay somewhere else with more bang for the buck. It's hundreds of $$ per night that you have to spend on nice accommodations in this city whichever way you slice it, so might as well choose a more solid place. We also stayed one night at Marriott Sky Center near the airport, and that while that's even further out of the way than EAST, I felt it was a better deal overall - it was less money and better rooms. Regardless where you are in HK, you're going to spend a significant amount of time riding the MTR, so where you have to ride a few extra stops or not is not really a concern. On this note, a word of advice: if you're in HK for more than 1 day and intend to do some sightseeing, get a Visitor Octopus card (available right at the airport) - it's a super convenient way to get around. You just swipe it and go, as opposed to mucking around with change and having to buy tickets each time.
