Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: cupidosiris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the East Hotel in Hong Kong over the long Easter weekend, 2011. It's a hotel for both business and pleasure and we enjoyed many things about it. The breakfast was good, the rooms well appointed, and the roof top bar a real pleasure. We found the location, near an MTR station, convenient. We had the harbour view and thought it was great. If we return to Hong Kong we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travellers who want a quieter stay.”
Reviews.Author: Nitramox1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an Urban Corner room on the 12th floor for six nights. The room has floor to ceiling windows as many do these days, though you can close your blinds. This hotel is ideal for business travellers, and a spa would complement it - it does have a pool and a gym though. Staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant serves a variety of international dishes, so you'll need to go elsewhere for the full authentic local experience. Pros: Free wi-fi, Elemis bath amenities, rain shower with marble floor, in-room safe, in-room coffee & tea service, hotel is connected to the mall and MTR, everything a business traveller needs is available. Cons: Building surrounded by nearby residences, small bathroom mirror, a little out of the way of main tourist attractions - but only a little.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in an interesting area of HK Island off the tourist trail”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We had stayed in Causeway Bay, Tsim Sha Tsui and Mong Kok before, and loved all of them, but wanted to stay somewhere a little less toursity. East was a great choice. The location is Kai Too is still very accessible (it's about 3 stations past Causeway Bay on the metro), but it's a world away from Central and TST. Kai Too is prime middle class territory so it gives you an interesting 'slice of life' for the 'real' Hong Kong (or one of them), The train and tram are withi very easy walk. There is a great shopping mall attached to the hotel. There are many restaurants and eateries nearby, and even more if you venture to nearby Shau Kau Wen. The hotel itself is quite good. I loved the swimming pool - big enough for real laps. The room was compact and could have been better designed (an easy chair or two would have been nice, as would better luggage storage), but the rooftop bar Sugar (named for the area's former sugar refinery) is fantastic, the beds are comfortable and the rooms are quiet. The hotel markets itself to business travellers, but it's also a good choice for tourists looking for something a bit different.

Reviews.Title: “All Class”
Reviews.Author: Melster27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at East on Christmas Eve and have to say that we were very impressed from check-in to check-out. The rooms were chic, clean with magnificent views. There are lots of odern gadgets and a super comfy bed. The staff were professional and efficient. We spent some time in the roof top bar 'Sugar' and the service was incredible. We also had a buffet lunch in Feast and everything was delicious and ran smoothly. With its location close to shopping, cinema, skating and bus and MTR you cannot go wrong with a Hong Kong stay at East. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel. Away from Central but subway very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Dasha D
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights, cool hotel with an urban, casual feel. We had a harbour view room on 27th floor, amazing views. Helpful staff who booked several restaurants for us. Good sized room, not huge, not tiny. Also plenty of amenities like iPod stereo, tv and computer cables, adaptors, etc. Location is good but it depends on your preference. It is in Taikoo, about 25 mins away from Central by the subway. But the subway station is literally next door, so that is quite convenient. Also the Taikoo location makes it cheaper than the hotels in the Central area. Happy we stayed there but would probably try to stay in Central for our next trip to Hong Kong, if the prices aren't too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not recommended for vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Mine F
Reviews.Content: We staid at East Hotel for New Year season. Most of the good hotels in the central area were fully booked for the New year season so we thought why not try this trendy-looking hotel? ;) bad idea and here is why I say so: PRO: trendy rooms, impeccable view from around the 20th floor and above (otherwise your view is the building in front of the hotel!), very close to the subway and medium size mall, free wifi. CONS: location (a bit far from central & Tsim sha tsui. It's about 15min on subway), the staff is cold for Hong Kong's friendly atmosphere, nothing much happening around the hotel neighborhood, Oh andstaff housekeeping crew just do the bed and give a quick fix to the room. If you spilled some juice on the floor and wiped quickly but still sticky.. Well be sure to see it there until you check out .. This is no exeption for glass doors stains! Its to wonder when the room was properly cleaned! There was a bad smell in our room for our last 4 nights there (a bad smell of plumbing malfunction in the bathroom! Yes, I know!! The A/C was of a good help!!), housekeeping was on our case to clean our rooms! Being on vacation we wanted to wake up whenever not by the housekeeping team ringing the bell over and over again! Doesn't help to leave the "Do not disturb" light on. Overall, never again. Will stick to the central/Tsim sha tsui area.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not for you if you are shy”
Reviews.Author: trempel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in one of their Urban Corner rooms on the 10th floor for three nights. The room has floor to ceiling windows but we had our blinds shut the whole time as residents from buildings across the street have a clear view of our entire room. This hotel is ideal for business traveller but not for leisure guests as it is rather cold and impersonal. All in all it was not a bad stay but we won't go back as we felt claustrophobic not being able to open the blinds and their Front Desk staff was rude and not helpful when we asked to have our room changed. Pros: Free wi-fi, Elemis bath amenities, rain shower with marble floor, in-room safe, in-room coffee & tea service, hotel is connected to the mall and MTR. Cons: Building surrounded by nearby residences, hotel lacks personality, staff are not well-trained, terrible bathroom mirror and lighting, too many switches for lights, non-smoking policy is not strictly enforced on a non-smoking floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: RudyTokyo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights for a short stop-over vacation. The hotel is very new and modern and the staff provide friendly and at attentive service. The hotel is next to a large mall including a movie theater, but otherwise the immediate vicinity doesn't have much to offer. That said, the hotel is right next to the MTR subway and HK taxis are cheap so it was easy to get to other locations such as Causeway Bay for nice restaurants and night-life. The breakfast which includes a main course and the buffet was excellent. The views from the Ocean-side rooms of the harbor and city-lights in Kowloon was spectacular. We had a minor issue with the shower drain blocking but otherwise this was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that Keeps on Giving...”
Reviews.Author: virginiaLJ1957
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we lived in HK for 15 years and are quite familiar w. this wonderful city. We never entertained the thought of staying at a hotel that was not in the Central area until a friend told us about the East. With a bit of skepticism we gave it a try well over a year ago. Since then, we have been back numerous times and feel like it is a "home away from home". We just spent Christmas there with our adult son and loved our 6 day stay at The East. When the hotel learned we were returning, they pulled out all the stops to make us feel so welcome and we felt like VIPs. On all of our stays, we all noticed how the staff were extremely genuine and how each one could not do enough for us to make our time there a very comfortable and happy one. It is the attention to the small details that have made a big difference for us in deciding over and over to return to the East. Upon learning of my back problems and need to swim, the East ensured the pool temperature was as warm as possible for me in the cold month of December; the manager took time from her busy schedule to personally meet with us for a coffee; we were given extra coffee in our room every day after the first time when I asked the attendant in the hallway for another packet (i.e., he must have noted the room number and made a point to leave some extra packs each day of my stay); immediate replies to my various emails were always forthcoming from the staff when I had queries about the weather, the pool, the Christmas Day lunch menu... and so on. It is abundantly clear that the staff love their jobs and are happy at the East..in turn, this means the customer will be very well cared for. I felt like the hotel took great pains with all the details - the layout of the room is very good given the space constraints in HK; one is provided w a small ironing board and iron, gorgeous coffee maker and separate kettle to boil water, small fridge, hair dryer, wonderfully warm robes and slippers; complimentary water bottles.... they forgot nothing! I was very happy with the location of the Hotel - it was a short MTR ride to Central; the City Plaza shopping center is right across the road (bridge connection directly from the hotel); streets were nice enough to go for long walks in the evening (I'm an avid walker). The Feast restaurant is wonderful with a superb salad and appetizer buffet and dessert buffet (along with a main course choice if you wish) - again, excellent value. An a la carte menu is also available for those wanting lighter fare. We checked on pricing for some hotels in Central to compare them to the East. We could get 2 rooms at the East for less than one room at a centrally located hotel. Excellent value without question. I don't know that this a place to bring children as I am not sure what the Hotel provides for kids. It seemed more like an "adult" friendly hotel. So, if you are bringing younger children you might want to ask what is available to make their stay a happy one. Hope you will have as great an experience as we did if you stay at the East.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlbeeTheOne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the Taikoo MTR train station. It is perfect if you are on a business trip. The rooms are comfy, and the staff is attentive. I had a room called the Harbor view. The other option available was the Urban view, which is a slightly economic. The hotel had good wi fi, a flat screen tv, and a modern bathroom with a rain shower. It has a pool and a gym on the fourth floor. They have a restaurant called Feast on the first floor. The hotel is adjacent to the City Plaza mall for shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyHomemaker
Reviews.Content: Not the most convenient for tourists, but if you have business in the quarry bay or tai koo area, then very good location. It is at the taikoo mtr station. The cityplaza mall is next door and connected by a bridgeway, which has lots of shopping and dining options. There is a park and running track nearby, as well as a good gym in the hotel. Rooms are very modern, nice comfy bed, big tv concealed behind a print, and various connectivity options hidden at the desk, like lan, as well as hdmi and vga to the tv. Free wifi available. Bathroom also very modern, with both rain shower and telephone shower. If you take the airport express from the airport, take note that there is no free shuttle bus to this hotel, you will need to take the mtr or a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jerry C
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights from Dec 5. Room was not ready upon our arrival due to hotel too full, it's sweet that front desk gave us free coupon for drinks at the cafe. hotel is new & hip not only the hardware but the staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip in November”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days at the modern, even chic, East Hotel in Hong Kong and overall enjoyed my time there. This was helped by the fact that the room was very comfortable with excellent panoramic views over Victoria harbour. It is even possible to have a shower looking over the waterway. The staff were attentive and tried hard to please - although the concept of receiving your breakfast bill before the food arrived was at first amusing. I also eat in the resturaunt one evening and again the food was of a good quality and the roof top bar was a bonus for a quick nightcap watching the nightlife in the warn evening air. The position of the hotel was a little way out from central but again the taxi ride was a short 10 minute drive and the hotel is adjacent to the MTR. I was working in the area so being so far from central was not a problem but for those wanting to be at the centre of activity then this should be considered. A good tip is when heading back to the airport is to use the check in facility at Central station before catching the train to the airport - it enabkes you to leave your heavy luggage there while you take a last minute stroll around central or even meal before heading for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goat4u
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 9 night stay at EAST. Very chic and modern hotel. The rooms were clean and the size was quite good for Hong Kong standards. The bathroom was clean and they also provided large bottles of shampoo/conditioner/bath soap so no need to worry about running out. The only complaint was the lighting in the room. In the day when the blinds are opened you will get plenty of light, but at night, even with all the room light, table light and night light on the room does get dark. Food wise, I never got a chance to eat at Feast since Tai Koo Mall is right next and attached to the hotel where there are plenty of options. Get of the elevator on the 1st floor and walk right. You will be in the mall. When you enter the mall on your left is Cafe de Coral which is a fast food place serving HK style cafe food. Yes it is not your 5 star restaurant, but the experience is fun. Watching them preparing your food is half the fun!!! At night they even have individual hot pot. If fast food is not your fair, keep walking left past the Cafe and you should be at 西苑 (next to the Watson) which serves authentic chinese Dim Sum. Try to avoid the lunch hour since finding a seat is nearly impossible. There are also bakeries and food courts in the Aptia department store in the mall basement. If you are more adventurous walk out of the hotel and go left or across the street. There are lots of restaurants and bakeries there too. Overall a pleasent stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: harrissafety
Reviews.Content: A very modern hotel where even the staff dress causal. The check is all done quickly and paperless, so good for environmental buffs. The hotel room is very good, however you do have to search the room for all the facilities, as they are a bit hidden. One quirky thing is room service, first time for me to order a meal and have it turn up in a paper bag, in paper containers with plastic knife and fork!!!! It might be my age, but I would have liked to eat my meal of a proper plate. If your looking for a drink the hotel bar at the top of the hotel is excellent, it has a open roof terrace and great views of Hong Kong and Kowloon. I would stay again on one of my next trips.

Reviews.Title: “Cool & Hip - Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from Hong Kong. I checked out of the hotel at 5:30 AM yesterday The 9th of November, and it was a breeze, as was check in. I arrived Sunday evening and the check was very smooth. Though I had prepaid for the room, the check in clerk asked me for a credit card for incidentals and additional charges. But when I checked out I decided to pay in cash, so my final receipt said paid by cash. I had booked a urban view room because it was less costly than a harbor view room, and beyond that I've been to HK so many times that I had no need to pay for that view. Tip: to see the harbor take a ride on the Star Ferry (next to the IFC tower in Central). Yes the view was of apartments building across the way but Hong Kong is a vertical city - so you should expect that. By the way, I arrived at about 10:30 PM and I was given an upgrade from Urban View to Urban Corner view. This means you have two sides with nearly floor to ceiling windows. More blinds to close but less traffic in the hallway since you are at the end of the hallway. Since it was late, and I wasn't all that familiar with the Tai Koo neighborhood, I ordered a Club Sandwich from Room Service. It arrived in less than 10 minutes, beautifully wrapped and the sandwich came with french fries and a couple of tasty onion rings plus your own small (1 1/2 inch high ketchup bottle). By the way - it is 9 MTR stops on the Island Line from Central (Hong Kong Station) where the Airport Express train takes you to Tai Koo. TIP: To reach the hotel which is directly adjacent to Tai Koo MTR station - Take the D1 exit. This is a major plus as you have to walk only a few steps to get from the MTR station to the Hotel. The room has a big flat panel Panasonic TV and in addition to the free Wi-Fi in the room, you can also choose from assorted cables (HDMI or VGA) depending on your lap-top set up and connect your PC to the big screen TV. The desk had a very comfortable desk chair but the room wasn't big enough to have a side chair. So if you are a couple, one person would have to sit on the bed and the other on the desk chair. However the more expensive suites do have more seating. As some else wrote, the walk-in shower does not have a door. But it is quite spacious and the water is plentiful, very hot, and with superb water pressure. You can use the Rainfall shower head which is mounted in the ceiling, or you can you use the wall mounted hand held nozzle that has a flexible cable. The bathroom sink is small and not very deep so you can expect to have some splash. Just move the bath mat from in front of the shower to in front of the sink. The toilet has just a frosted glass door but there is a phone in the toilet room. I had the breakfast in the hotel's restaurant called Feast (That's East plus an F for food). As you arrive on the first floor, a hostess will escort you to a table. I ordered coffee and went to take items from the buffet. Now in every other hotel in Asia that had a buffet breakfast - by the time you return from the buffet with your food, the coffee has been poured and is waiting for you. Not this time. It took about 12 minutes for my first cup of coffee, and it took extra time for a menu (for hot and cooked on order breakfast items like eggs and french toast, pancakes etc.) to arrive, and then my second cup of coffee also seemed to take extra time. In fact, I had to ask a second time. Since I had not booked the room with the breakfast included, I was going to have to pay for it. When I called for the chit, the waiter came over and said that per his manager, they were apologizing for the lengthy delays, and that the breakfast would be on the house. No charge. While that was nice for me financially, I was more impressed that the manager knew about the delay and had waived the charges without me even complaining verbally. So the major plusses are the proximity to the MTR station and it is only 15 minutes to Central. The classy neighborhood with a huge shopping mall right next door which included a six-theater movie multiplex. The staff wore tee shirts, jeans and black topped sneakers, or the same with blazers, and everyone spoke excellent English and the front desk concierge people were terrific. The rooms were attractive and had a big big TV. The hotel also offered a shuttle directly to the airport at 130 HK (if you take the airport express and the MTR to Central it would be 106 - the amounts in US dollars is 16.71 versus 13.62 for door to door service). And I received an upgrade to a corner room (18th Floor) without asking for it. The minus was the slow breakfast service. But in fairness - they were hosting a business conference, and I happened to go down for breakfast on Monday morning at 8:15 so the delays were really a-typical. And the room is smallish. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: sssshhhh80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights recently. Very nice, clean, stylish rooms. Only problem is the see through glass in the bathroom - ok if you are alone or with your partner, a bit more of an issue when sharing with friends! In a nice, clean part of East Hong Kong Island. Very nice and helpful staff. Bar is really nice with great views, restaurant ok. Right next to the MTR station. MOST COMFORTABLE BED EVER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern yet satisfying”
Reviews.Author: TheSaters
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time as I was in HK for business. The modern look and feel of the hotel was quite refreshing and the clever use of the space in the room was also impressive. The rooftop lounge/Bar is a must although the menu lacked any chinese food items !! Would stay there again for sure. Having a metro station next door is also quite handy.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: k_win93
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, in fact still here as I write this, and I think it is a great place to stay. The rooms are excellent and from the upper floors at least the views are amazing. The rooftop open-air bar, called Sugar, has lovely views across the harbour to Kowloon, and has a great atmosphere. The staff are very helpful and always attentive but not intrusive. The hotel is handily placed, with the TaiKoo Shing shopping mall and Tai Koo MTR station next door. If I come back to HK I would hope to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel East”
Reviews.Author: HSV12
Reviews.Content: Boutique Hotel located just next to Taikoo station. 15 min taxi from Hong Kong Station if taking Airport Express in. Modern rooms that are based on asthetics rather than function. Good clean rooms none the less. Suites have fantastic view of the harbour but Urban view rooms have someone's living room at your face. Typical of close proximity living i guess.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrtravelmore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for business. I really like the sleek design and the ambiance of the hotel. Room was small but very nicely furnished and cosy. Its has open bathroom concept.. small, but its adequate for a solo traveler. Room service was prompt, and concierge was very helpful with small requests. It has a very good restaurant on the first floor, good for breakfast and lunch (might be very packed during lunch hour so better book a table first) If you stay at this hotel, you must go to 'Sugar', the rooftop bar on level 32. The view is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “a suite with real 'wow factor'”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a Harbour View Suite - and I have to say that this is one of the best suites I've ever stayed in. End-to-end and floor-to-ceiling windows offered amazing views of the harbour, we had a 'deep tub bath with a view', there was a bubble chair straight out of a 60s spy movie and a quirky fibreglass dinosaur designed by one of China's up and coming sculptors. Wow! But East isn't only about the suite. The rooftop bar, Sugar, also had fabulous views, the pool was stylish and the restaurant, Feast, offered great food and some Paul Smith stripes. East thoroughly deserves its Hot Pink rating on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “not good at this price”
Reviews.Author: janiceyaoyao
Reviews.Content: I was living in this hotel from october 12 to october 22, around 10 days. dislikes: 1. i found this hotel is pretty dark, not just the rooms but the elevator as well. 2. The room is well designed but not the bathroom. The sink is not deep enough, so everytime when i wash my face the water spill out and i need to put a towel on the floor everyday just is very ignoring. 3. although i turn off the water after I took a shower, but there are some water dripping from the ceiling. 4. the room service is not detail enough. After the daily cleaning, i still found the cup is dirty and there are still some hair in the bathroom. 5. The bed and cover sheets are not soft or i can say pretty rough. If i am not tired enough, i don't think i will be able to get some sleep on it. 6. slow internet and it always disconnect so i need to retype the password in order to go online. 7. The breakfast they provide doesn't taste that great, it doesn't worth with that money. The ham and the bacon are so dry and hard. 8. I don't like people working there wearing sneakers. I don't think it's appropriate to wear them in a 4 star hotel (i heard it's a 4 star). 9. security card key is not sensitive enough, everytime we need to try a couple of times in order to go upstairs through the elevator and get into the room. 10. the "do not disturb" button is not properly explained to us after we checked in. We have no idea what's the red light means and we have to figure it out by ourselves. likes: 1. well designed room accept the bathroom 2. a lot of channels to select from on the tv 3. Big space at this price. Overall this hotel is not a cheap hotel but paying this much money getting this kind of service and quality just wasn't good enough. Personally, i won't book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good with drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: TeesiderTeddybear
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel based on other tripadvisor reviews and overall it worked for us. First and foremost it is mainly designed for business users but it can work for travelers if you have a flexible nature. The good points are : Location, it is right next to a modern shopping mall and MTR station, if you know Hong Kong you will know that the transportation systems are probably the best in the world, some may think it is a bit far from the bright lights but that is not the case, nowhere is very far away in Hong Kong ( I used to live in this City) The Hotel itself is ultra modern in design and in its function, the staff are all very young but I have to say they are all very efficient and polite. There is a "trendy" bar on the top floor with fantastic views, the food & drink is very good if not a little pricey. We found the breakfasts just ok. The rooms themselves I suspect you will either love them or hate them, not quite hating them this was our only real negative, they are best described as open plan with no designated bathroom area and with no privacy, as I say it will be great for some but not for others, you have to know your partner very well if you get my drift, having said all that I would certainly use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CDinBKK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at East after a mix up with another hotel. The rooms and service were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Fun filled holiday!”
Reviews.Author: trevorrose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I together with our daughter and son-in-law have just spent 8 days in Hong Kong and stayed at the East Hotel in North Point. We chose it because it was a new hotel and was out of the hustle and bustle of central Hong Kong. It turned out to be a fantastic choice because this Hotel is amazing! It is brand new and the rooms are ultra modern. We had Harbour View rooms and the views were like something from a postcard - the whole width of the room was window!!! No need to worry about too much light to sleep - a block out blind made the room totally dark! The views from rooms on the city side were great too. Our room was fully equipped and quite large (not too sure about the toilet being behind frosted glass doors????) and the bed was totally comfortable and it was totally quiet! The Hotel offers FREE high speed wireless internet throughout the hotel, (about time the other 95% of hotels in the world provided this essential service!) catering especially for business travellers. But it was the amazing service we received from all the staff that made our stay so great. Nothing was too much trouble for them and their politeness and service was five star! Nowhere else in the world have we received such a standard of service - The East tops them all! There is a restaurant/cafe on the first level, serving meals all day at very reasonable prices (the high tea was superb!) and a unique bar on level thirty called "Sugar" which has to be seen to be believed! It is on top of the hotel and has indoor and outdoor seating with views out over Victoria Harbour and Kowloon Bay that will knock your socks off day or night! Drink prices were on a par with anywhere in HK and the staff can whizz up any tipple of your choice. It stays open until the wee small hours and serves meals and snacks as well. Suffice to say we spent quite some time there! The location of The East means it is quite a distance from the city centre, but with an MTR station located next door it took us about twenty minutes to get to Central on the fast, clean, cheap trains which run no longer than 5 minutes apart! There is the huge City Plaza shopping mall next door which has many restaurants and a food court, so there is no need to travel at all if you don't want to. Times Square shopping mall was 10 minutes by MTR and the up-market Pacific Place 15 minutes away, so shoppers can be in paradise very quickly! Overall, if you want a great place to stay and don't mind using public transport to get about then I can thoroughly recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic cool and trendy place to stay just 15 minutes from central.”
Reviews.Author: HongKongCallisto
Reviews.Content: Great 'cool' hotel by the group who own Upper House and Opposite House but at much less of a price. Good sized rooms with great showers - get a room higher up if you can. Very casual and laid back - staff wearing converses.... Use this place for business guests a lot. Favourite spot is the bar called Sugar on 32nd floor - uber cool chilled out. Awesome outdoor views of old Kai Tek and sea. One of my best spots in Hong Kong. Staff are lovely and well trained, food great and bar choice excellent.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has been the highlight of my trip to HK”
Reviews.Author: marjoo
Reviews.Content: East is probably one of the better hotels I've ever stayed at. From the moment you walk in they make you feel very welcome. My girlfriend & I really had to get used to the rudeness of the Hong Kong people so it was really great to stay in such a heartwarming hotel with the kindest staff you could possibly imagine. Room Service - I love the way delivered it to the room in a recycle bag & everything. Very 2011. Good food & for roomservice not very pricey either! The room itself - We stayed in an urban view double room. Very 'zen!'. Didn't really enjoy the view though, I find the buildings across the street a little too urban looking (dirty!) but it's not like East has got something to say about the state of them buildings. Pretty much all buildings in HK are like that and I guess that's Urban eh? Now wish I would have booked a room on the other side but still very very pleased with the room we were in. The shower is amazing. Very powerful & love how it 'rains' on ur head! ;) The last 2 days of our stay I found the water to be a little bit smelly though! The bed was amazing, the matrass shaped to ur body! Area - There's a lot in and around the hotel. There's a lovely pool & gym on the 4th floor. There's of course the rooftop bar. And around the hotel there's City Plaza, which is basicly a massive mall with a cinema, a few restaurants & loads of shops (Toys R us, H&M, etc.) & the hotel is literally about 10 steps away from the Tai Koo metro station. Hospitality - Check out was at 12 which was great cos we only had to be at the airport at 7:30 in the evening. So they let us leave all of our luggage at the hotel after being checked out & we spent the day in Ocean Park. We got back to the hotel by 6 & even though we had been checked out for 6 hours they took us and our luggage to floor 4, where they let us use the Gym's bathrooms to shower, change clothers & get ready for our flight back to Amsterdam. I found this ABSOLUTELY amazing. Conclusion - Lovely hotel, amazingly nice staff, good area & very nice & stylish room!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: 220travel2011220
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in, the rooms where great clean and modern, fantastic shower, quiet, dark and tranquil. The staff couldnt do enough for us, I left my diamond rings in the room, the cleaner called the front desk, to let them know and they came up to the room whilst she cleaned it, they called me when we got back to the hotel to remind us to put our rings in the safe. The food was fantastic and the hotel restuarant had great service. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fkirill
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there only one night to have comfortable sleep between the flights. The hotel is quite expansive but it is really-really-really nice! I would definitely recommend it to a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, comfortable with large (for HongKong!) rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fikoukla
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and would do again. For the price the hotel has a great standard with boutiquey touches without some of the pretentiousness and $$$$$$s that can come attached. Personally didn't think the location was exciting, though it's right next to an ok mall, so for personal trips would stay elsewhere, but coming through for business I'd stay here again. Free wifi and decent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lavagtan
Reviews.Content: We spent our last two days in Hong Kong at this hotel after traveling around China. It is a hip modern hotel in an area that is non-touristy. The MTR is right next door and there are signs in the MTR indicating the way to the East Hotel. Once emerging from the MTR the hotel is right in front of you. The Lobby was cool and the room was clean, funky and modern. Room had all the amenities that I would typically need: Ipod playing radio, free Wi Fi, Coffee and Tea in the morning, ironing board...etc. Bathroom is fairly open to the room, so if any privacy is needed, you won't necessarily get it in the standard room. The room had huge floor to ceiling windows, which was nice and made the room feel bigger. And it was pretty quiet in the room. Didn't hear much noise out in the Hall. The Bar at the top of the hotel was great too, however, we didn't get to take advantage of the view because they were doing some construction. Pool area seemed to be good for hanging out or taking a swim; It is right outside the gym. Ate at the restaurant: The food was good, but I thought it was rather expensive considering there is a mall attached to this building with restaurants and restaurants and a bakery right across the street. Location didn't hinder us from seeing or doing anything since the MTR is right there. All in All I think it is a good place to stay and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a non turistic location”
Reviews.Author: maclover_it
Reviews.Content: East hotel is a very good business hotel located in Quarry Bay, hence a bit off the usual beaten paths of Central/Wan Chai or Kowloon. Hotel itself is pretty new and adjacent to a big shopping mall, plenty of dining options. It conveniently sits right above Tai Koo MTR station of Island line and getting to Central is really easy and fast (approx. 15 minutes). I'd strongly suggest this hotel if you have business in North Point/Quarry Bay area, otherwise is a bit off the way, especially from Kowloon side as you have to transfer at Admiralty. Sure it's a great alternative if 4* hotel prices get on the high rates during peak events in HK

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: LizM26
Reviews.Content: I am a female sole business traveller who spent 6 nights at East duing a business trip to HK. It was a wonderful experience. This hotel has a calm, serene atmosphere and very attentive staff who remember the little things (e.g. that I have my coffee decaf, my name). It was the ambiance of the hotel, and beautiful clean lines that really captured me. I love the design of the rooms, although do agree with a recent reviewer that it might not be durable enough to last the harsh wear and tear of a busy hotel. The food, atmosphere and service at Feast is excellent. I ate both breakfast and dinner, and was equally impressed. Sugar rooftop bar is also very nice (although did not feel comfortable going there solo). The gym facilities were excellent. The hotel also has a sky bridge to the City Plaza shopping centre were their is a huge selection of shops to suit all budgets and styles. I really like Muji (the Japanese store) which is right near the hotel. You can even go ice skating at the plaza rink, if you feel inclined. I caught the MTR to Central / Causeway Bay / TST and Lantau Island. Whilst Tai Koo is a more residential district, it is easy and quick to connect to other parts of HK. The MTR station is about 20 steps from the hotel entrance. My only (quite pathetic) complaint was there no powerpoint at the sink, so I couldn't dry my hair as I normally would. I had to sit on the bed! Overall - A super hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really modern hotel in great location with spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: Gaz_Gaz25
Reviews.Content: When we arrived late at night I thought that they must have employed casual staff after hours but soon realised that all staff dressed in smart casual, I thought this was a really groovy touch. The staff here are nothing short of awesome, they speak excellent English and cannot do enough to make your stay a pleasant one, they go out of their way to help you, we even asked for a heap of postage to be sent back to Australia and they took care of it all for us. Our room was located on the top floor below Sugar, it had magnificent views cof the harbour and urban buildings, only thing I would say is that when the sun comes up even when the blinds are closed, it is too bright to sleep in, so we were up early each day. Loved how the room was set out and your bill and room service menu etc is all located on an iPod, so very modern indeed! Food here is delicious and comes delivered in take away bag and container (recyclable) it is also reasonable priced. Sugar bar and club is a really cool place to hang out at night and has sweeping views of the harbour, all table service and comfortable. Don’t be put off by the location of this hotel as the Tai Koo station is literally next door, just grab your self and Octopus card and makes for a very fast and cheap way to get around, the train system is amazing and never waited more than 2 minutes for one to arrive. If you like really cool, hip and modern hotels, you will absolutely love this place, it would have to be the most modern and groovy hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A Minimal Experience”
Reviews.Author: Az0i
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, Quite minimal, but comfortable. Staff friendly. Some nice touches in the room. The hotel is around a year old and I am not sure if the decor is durable enough to look good in say another 2 years, but all that said, it is on top of a good mall (no need for hotel breakfast) and the Tai Koo MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: MalcAdams
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several weeks and quite simply it is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Handy location next to MTR and City Plaza mall. Great interior design, excellent use of room space, modern, relaxed and comfortable. Incredibly efficient yet polite and friendly staff, excellent food at Feast but highlighted by Sugar for drinks and lighter meals siituated on 32nd floor. A breathtaking view of the bay, a fabulous vibe and intentive bar staff. Hard to find fault.

Reviews.Title: “A Modern Hotel at Tai Koo District”
Reviews.Author: Jenny K
Reviews.Content: When I visited Hong Kong, I usually stay at Park Lane Hotel (Causeway Bay). However, I want to get a different experience. That’s why I try East Hotel. The hotel is well located. Tai Koo MTR station D1 exit / entrance is exactly next to the hotel and CityPlaza is just couple-steps away. The East Hotel is decorated in minimalist style. The room is clean and spacious. The interesting part is that toilet, shower and sink are separated; they are covered by see-through glass. When you stay at The East Hotel, I highly recommend visiting the SUGAR. It is a bar-deck lounge located at the 32nd floor of the East Hotel. It provides a stunning view of the city and the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: carlalci
Reviews.Content: Very convenience! The hotel is just located next to Tai Koo MTR Station, also a huge shopping mall. You can go shopping, eating or enjoy a movie easily. The room is clean and bright, the bed is comfortable and large! The staffs are very friendly and helpful; we will stay there another day!

Reviews.Title: “Designer chic - close to business area - on MTR - just don't eat here!”
Reviews.Author: Sioseeker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times as it is close to the Quarry Bay business district. Right on Tai Koo MTR but a long way from TST and quite a few stops to Causeway Bay. Also right next to a huge shopping and eating plaza (food court and some restaurants). Very designer chic. Everything has subdued lights, the staff (many) are all in casual attire (and look like guests). Rooms are full of so many features you will never work out how all the things actually operate. I gave up on the coffee maker - just too complicated. It was on my last day that I found the electric blind switch. Rooms are very spacious and if you are on the higher floors, the views over the harbour are just amazing. If you are on the "other side" of the hotel or on the lower floors, the views are urban (read low income high rise). Very business orientated with a desk in the room, roller chair, desk lamp and fabulous high speed WiFi. The roof top bar - Sugar - is a highlight (you need to book but as a guest you get proirity). However this was undergoing renovations when i was last there and the terrace was closed. The food isn't fantastic at either the roof top bar or the Feast level 1 restaurant. All designer show and fuss but quality was lacking. I was ill on all trips where I had eaten at the hotel. I feel the food handling chain is too long or not enough attention to use by dates. On my last trip I paid by credit card that was used only at the hotel and ended up with a $US3,000 fraud use in Dubai and subsequently had all my cards cancelled by the bank whilst I was away. Inconvenient and ugly. No direct accusations - just relating the story. It is a busines hotel and they are sticklers for accurate reservations and occupancy rates. I was "upgraded" to a corner room - but was then told it was on the smoking floor. Modern, chic, business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, will be back for sure!!”
Reviews.Author: jojo_Macau
Reviews.Content: I have always been a Langham Place girl whenever I go to Hong Kong, but this time my boyfriend booked East Hong Kong and I am very very happy with his choice! Check in - Arrived at around 8pm, very fast, just a few minutes. Booked an urban view room, upgraded to Urban corner room without request. The room - Modern design, wooden floor, average size, huge comfy bed, very clean. The room has free wifi, mineral water, tea, coffee with an expresso machine in your room! It has an open shower place, that is, your roommate can see you shower from the room, so might not be suitable for people who are shy. We have the urban view corner room, so not much of a view, just buildings. Will get a harbour view room next time! The room also has an iPod Touch, you can browse info and order room service with it. Room service - A small menu. Food is yummy and price is reasonable, except for the soup which the portion is just too small. They deliever the food to you in take away boxes which is different from other hotels. Staff - Very friendly, helpful and efficient. Location - on the Hong Kong Island, just 10-15 minutes taxi away from Central. It's linked to a huge shopping center and MTR station is right next door. Check out - very fast as usual. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: TC_Foong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights but had paid for 5 nights. My flight arrived from Australia on 10th July but my hotel booking showed stay booked from 9th to 14th. Tried reasoning with Check -In personnel that there was an error in the pre-booking & pre-paying but they would not budged and insisted that I will need to pay if my stay need to be extended for another night. Sensing the futility in arguing I decided not to extend my stay with them. It was my first time at the East Hotel located in Taikoo Shing Road. The room was generous in size despite being located on HK Island. The decor was nice and the shower was separated from the WC which doesn't really bothers me as I travelled alone. Had trouble locating the TV as it was ingeneously hidden by a piece of painting. The bed was comfy. Would have stayed on but the location was a bit out of town and away from main shopping area of Causeway Bay. The gym was a bit disappointing in that there is no sauna/steam room or jaccuzi. The pool was deserted most time despite temps of over 30Deg every day I was there. The best thing was the in room coffee maker!! The housekeeping was good as they noticed that I love the coffee machine and left behind extra coffee satchels for me. Good overall experience and would not mind returning despite the hiccup over the mis-booking dates.

Reviews.Title: “classy and efficient”
Reviews.Author: parma58
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in. Its new, fresh, exciting, bright and the service is absolutely first class. its location is ideal with a link to the shopping mall where you could be spoilt for choice not only for clothing, but a wide choice in restaurants. The MTR station is literally outside the door, without the intrusion of thousands of commuters. Its in a quiet and peaceful location within an exciting and bustling city. A perfect place to relax, and from which you can explore this exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: choosychacha
Reviews.Content: Ignore the reviews which say it is too far out, it's perfect. The hotel is on the doorstep of Tai Koo MTR and takes about twenty minutes to Central. Getting to Kowloon on the MTR from the hotel is also pretty easy. The staff are great (although they do sem somewhat overstaffed). The hotel is lovely and very reasonably priced. If you like a stroll or a run in the morning, it's two minutes from the harbour which is great to run along and means that you're not stopping for traffic all the time. The only downside is that the bar on the rooftop is currently under refurbishment which means you can't go out on to the balcony, this was a major reason for me booking so a shame I was unable to use it. The views however from the bar are great. Try SEVVA too or the Ritz Carlton for drinks with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a different part of town”
Reviews.Author: sfo2mnl
Reviews.Content: Clean modern rooms. The rain shower was a nice touch. Next to a mall and the Taikoo MTR station. About 15 minutes to Central by MTR and a $70 cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but we didn't enjoy it”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Guru-Kat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Oct and we were booked to spend 6 nights but ended up only staying for 2 nts and then we changed hotels. The hotel itself is beautiful, very impressive building, modern decor and facilities. The food was excellent and we loved the room service. We found the hotel quite impersonal and it felt more like a business hotel for city traders. As we were on vacation we felt a little uncomfortable here (even though we have stayed in many 5 star hotels). The hotel is right next to a mall (most shops closed at 10pm) and this was handy but there was nowhere else in walking distance. The subway station is right next door but it would have been good to have a few more things nearby. We had a fantastic room, huge panoramic windows with amazing views, lots of gadgets and modern decor. There were lots of tv channels and the bed was huge. We used the swimming pool one day and we were the only ones there, we felt like it was more for show rather than use. When we moved we stayed in Kowloon and we really enjoyed it as it felt like we were seeing more of the real Hong Kong with all the hustle and bustle and we could walk to the night markets.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place. Except for nearly all "design" objects are faked goods”
Reviews.Author: S_von_Linde
Reviews.Content: Well first of all, the rooms are spacious and modern and have very large windows. They are clean, the beds are good, everything functioned fine during two stays. The staff in the lobby is very helpful and polite, so is the staff in the gym as well. But something the owners definitely have to learn definitely is that original design objects really do satisfy partly due to their manufacturing quality, such as the Artemide Toio Lamp. It's faked couterpart produced by "Oasis Lighting" is not really comparable as it is crampy to adjust and just a cheap copy. Apart from these remarks, it was a nice, recommendable stay. Remarks: - There are several good restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel, an urban living area, i. e. a restaurant called something like "Grand Shanghai Cuisine" - There's also a good and cheap laundry service who will clean everything within tree hours, exit to the right, walk about 200 meters while you and pass the shopping center until you see a branch of a bank on the left and stairs going up right next to it. Go up the stairs, directly on the left you will find the "British Laundry Service", they have an orange sign.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Momo_on_vacation
Reviews.Content: Wow. This is my new favorite hotel. Compared to the dense, urban environs of Hong Kong, this hotel was a true calm oasis. Whoever designed this hotel deserves kudos for room layout: everything was exactly where it should be. My room (Urban View) was immaculate and extremely quiet (including the air conditioning!). The hotel location was perfect, with easy access to the metro station (literally next door) and a short 10 min ride to downtown. I absolutely loved the staff, they were incredibly polite and friendly, and they spoke English very well. I was quite impressed that they let me borrow a laptop for free, along with complimentary wi-fi. I'm not usually the breakfast buffet type but morning breakfast turned out to be excellent with a hot entree made to order and fresh pressed coffee. I was less fond of the dinner I had in their restaurant but I'm a vegetarian so admitedly there wasn't much to choose from. As a solo traveler, I felt extremely comfortable in this hotel. This hotel has managed to get everything right, down to the very last detail. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Consultbishop
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice a month for the last 12 months. It is a very good hotel and the price is excellent value for money, especially if you can get the 30 day advanced purchase.

Reviews.Title: “East is BEST”
Reviews.Author: Ostgut_Perth
Reviews.Content: I had a weekend in East Hotel to finish off a hostel-based backpacking holiday in style, and this place did not disappoint. It's marketed as a business hotel, which is perfect if you want a sleek place with no screaming kids or the cast from national lampoons vacation. A few points to note: - The hotel is located in the east side of hong kong island; however, is directly linked to a metro station, which takes less than 10 minutes to get you to central / admirality station (i.e. it's relatively close to everything whilst being far from everything). - It's attached to a shopping mall, which has a great asian food court that covers most cuisines of the region at great prices (i.e. if you love having drunken chicken with broth or an array of dumplings for breakfast, then you'll be in heaven). - Said shopping mall has a Uniqlo store, WHAT, I HAVEN'T SEEN ONE SINCE LIVING IN LONDON (sorry, this was a shock to see uniqlo here). - There is an Ipod Touch in every room, which unfortunately has the internet browser disabled; HOWEVER, East hotel has kindly loaded it up with a few swanky playlists to make you feel like you're in a swanky hotel (nice touch East, nice touch....). Extra special note related to hong kong but not East - If you're flying a major airline you can actually check in your luggage at Central Station, which to me blew my mind. It would be like checking in your luggage at Regent St in London, or Chatelet in Paris, or Alexander Platz in Berlin... but alas you cannot, because these places aren't Hong Kong, Ouuccchhhhh...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, modern & fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeGreg
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel, great size room for HK, great facilities (very nice coffee machine in the room) & comfy bed! Very close to the MTR, only a couple of stops to causeway bay & the nearby shopping mall came in handy for grabbing breakfast. Great service from the staff, we spent our last night in Asia at East before returning back to the UK (had been teaching in China for 18 months) & wanted to weigh our cases before heading off to the airport. One call to reception & someone promptly came to our room with a set of scales, which was really handy & very much appreciated! If you go through the MTR station (can't remember which exit) the airport bus stops just outside which is a very cheap way of getting back to the airport. Would definitely recommend East, we initially thought it might be a bit out of the way as had usually stayed very centrally in HK but found the location quick & easy to travel around from & it was nice to stay somewhere with a bit more space. The free high speed wi-fi was a brilliant bonus too, don't know how hotels can get away with charging so much for it these days so definitely appreciated this freebie!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooftop Bar”
Reviews.Author: loulouScotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new and very stylish. For Hong Kong it's good value aswell, which is probably due to the location which is a few metro stops from Central. That didn't bother us at all though, and it isnt any hassle getting here. The rooftop bar is something else, the place to be for sunset and a few drinks listening to the nice tunes the DJ plays. The rooms are great, we got a free upgrade to a harbour view and its very spacious,clean and modern with great views over towards Kowloon. The pool is good,although it doesn't get the sun all day, so you can only lie out till about 3 or 4. The toiletries are elemis in the bathrooms, which my wife loved. We also had some food at the rooftop bar,pizza, which was excellent as are the cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: paristosydney
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed in TST but decided to try this hotel based on my friend's recommendation & also the high rating on Tripadvisor. It's mainly business travellers but it deserves all the positive reviews. I was a leisure traveller & the hip young staff are terribly attentive & helpful - highly recommend. The hotel's location is only 5 stops on MTR from Causeway Bay (about 15-20 mins) so I found it really handy & not at all far from the centre of the action. It's a bit far from Kowloon/Hong Kong stations but not far if you're going to hang out in Central/Admiralty/Causeway Bay. Cityplaza right next door has so many of the basic shops anyway (Nike, Uniglo, H&M, M&S, food republic).I even got upgraded to a harbour view queen room which is amazing & looked out onto HK harbour! Free wifi in all rooms too - awesome! Positives: lovely staff, hip decor & rooms (I found this a little tricky to find stuff but I worked it out!), great soft rug in the room, ipod dock with hip playlists (I ended up writing alot of their songs down & have bought them off itunes myself), great little gym & pool with awesome individual changerooms with shower, towels etc. Wonderful & great value for money. If you're into the clubscene, Sugar on the topfloor is popular. Love the Elemis body products in the room as well. Negatives: don't get a cab from the airport - it's pricey about HKD300-350, instead get the shuttlebus (I think the hotel can organise or a desk at the airport)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for business”
Reviews.Author: Feej
Reviews.Content: Had a four night business stay, and although the hotel is not in central Hong Kong, it's a great place to stay. Check-in was easy and the room was a decent size for a single traveller. I would caution against staying here with anyone other than *very* close family, as the shower door is just clear glass and quite visable from within the room. Was very nice to have a good sized desk to work from in the evening and the free wireless was very much appreciated. While not in the centre of Hong Kong, there's an MTR station right outside the hotel. This will get you in to central in around 15-20 mins. There's heaps of shopping close by and of course it is very close to a lot of businesses. Looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Unwind at the End of the Day”
Reviews.Author: kellyfeeney
Reviews.Content: My brother and I just returned from a 3 day stay at the EAST Hong Kong...I would highly reccomend this hotel. We had made arrangements through the hotel for a car pick up at the airport (700HKD) because we weren't sure how complex it would be using either the MTR or a taxi. The driver was the waiting for us upon exit from baggage and after a short 35 minute ride to the hotel we were checked in immediately and off to our room on the 24th floor. Pleasantly suprised at how spaceious the room was as well as the FABULOUS VIEW of Hong Kong harbor. The room was spotless, beds were FANTASTIC, loved the bath products and the shower was the simply AWESOME; word to the wise though, the bathroom area is open and there isn't much privacy except in the enclosed toilet. Ordered room service one night and the food was really good. Everything about this hotel exceeded our expectations and so convienent to the MTR, literally right outside the hotel door is the entrance. If you are looking for a great place to unwind after a crazy day in Kowloon or any other part of Hong Kong, this is your ticket. Shopping close by at the CityPlaza and they are open late (around 9pm), dinning options and most of all the staff is very helpful and kind. I don't think you can go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: psychoactive
Reviews.Content: Pros: - New & Stylish - Neat modern rooms with all commodities - Decent breakfast - Convenient for Quarry Bay / Tai Koo area - Free high-speed internet Contras: - Windows cannot be open in the room = lack of daily oxygen - Young staff, often unexperienced - Breakfast is good but lacking hot dishes (sold separately from the buffet)

Reviews.Title: “New trendy hotel - at Quarry Bay”
Reviews.Author: travellerch63
Reviews.Content: Well you will be amazed when you enter the hotel - everything is new and top modern. Going to the top floor and have a look around is a must. If you need to work there is a shopping center close by where your spouse can spend all your money. The breakfast was very nice and I enjoyed the hotel. Two things were a bit odd: a) the rooms are a "bit" too small - and b) if you have a room towards the rear - make sure you put down the curtains for privacy - as the "neighbours" can otherwise see you taking a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and trendy!”
Reviews.Author: woot
Reviews.Content: much of this hotel has been mentioned in past reviews and is true so I'll just add a few tips, - pay slightly more and stay at the harbourview room ( it starts from floor 22 upwards to 29 and I was at 26) as the view is great even though you really cant fully raise the blinds. - take the shuttle bus bus direct from the hotel entrance to the airport on your last day out as this only sets you back 150HKD vs the 100HKD you would normally pay for the airport train/MTR as this saves you dragging your luggage through the MTR on your last day out. - there are many restaurants and eateries in city mall but if you turn left when you exit the hotel lobby and walk down for about 5 mins , you'll find 4-5 nice little HK diners which serves HK food and some even do take away so thats your room service there sorted. - cant really think of anything bad of the hotel but if i had to pick one then the location might not be great for those that want to be in all the action. its a few stops from central and may not be a good base for shopping as they are all in causeway bay,central or kowloon. - the water splashing out of the sink aint really that bad, just turn down the tap while washing out, no problem. the room is very clean and comfy and the complimentary coffee maker is really a plus. staff are friendly and will help you out if you need directions/advice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Santanu76
Reviews.Content: We loved the decor of the hotel - the modern styling of the toilets and the wide all encompassing windows with view in the bedroom. The staff were courteous and helpful and the location was perfect - just outside a metro station. All in all, we loved staying at the East and would definitely stay here again when we visit HK again. The hotel is value for money and the food is delicious, varied and fresh. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Penciltoon
Reviews.Content: Lucked out and got upgraded from a urban view corner room to harbor view corner room. Loved the experience staying here. The view from the room was fantastic. First of all, it is only 5 months new. Everything is so clean and nice smelling. There is a great coffee machine in the room. You can also ask for a foam pillow if you are not used to very soft pillows when sleeping. Service is quick, can't complain. Staff are all friendly. Only thing is if you are not travelling with your spouse, everything is open bathroom concept. So quite hard if travelling with friends. Found the elevators a bit slow. There are only four. Loved Sugar, the rooftop bar. Was there every night. It's closed during lunch and only opens at 5:00pm. Great music too! Best to go there at 5:00 so you see the sun set. It is connected to City Plaza Mall. There is an ice skating rink, Toys R Us and game room which is good if you have kids. It has Apita which is a supermarket. Not too many high end shops - more of the mid range. You can take the bus to Central, more convenient than taking the MRT coz it's right infront of the hotel. I will definitely come back. Had a great time!! You need to be familiar with HK a bit to appreciate the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vkrishna77
Reviews.Content: East hotel is an excellent hotel with very good ambience and service. I have stayed there for few weeks couple of times and was complete struck with their exceptional hospitality. The location of this hotel also makes it a place to stay when you are in hongkong. The MTR station is just next to the hotels exit and that makes life easy for travelling around HK. First time when i booked this hotel i was not sure how it would be and was a bit skeptical, but the service and ambience stuck me and now i always stay at this hotel whenever i travel to hongkong. Restaurent is really good and serves one of best cuisines around that place, i have been to their restaurent on the top floor and the appearance really stucks one. East hotel hongkong is a place I would definitely come back to and recommend to my friends and colleagues. Thank you very much for making our stay so pleasant!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place...very modern decor”
Reviews.Author: PiaShome
Reviews.Content: We booked East Hong Kong for our stay. I was surprised by the splash of colour and the modern decor. The rooms have been stylishly designed with glasses all over. We got a room on the 14th floor which has a great view. The MTR, metro station , was just next to the hotel. The hotel also has some great food. Do stay for a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern unconventional hotel with excellent roof top restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ANK32
Reviews.Content: I was there on business travel and Hotel EAST is quite close to our office that's why I stayed there. It is a modern hotel and unlike other hotels where you find formal attire wearing employees greeting you, here we have the reception all informal with T Shirts and casuals as the reception dress. The Hotel is beautiful one with nice rooms well done and planned. The location of Hotel is not exactly central but with HK transport facilities it should not be a reason not to stay here unless someone has specific work on other side of town. The most I liked is the roof top restuarant, it is excellent and HK weather during evenings made it unforgettable, the speedy winds just takes one to another world and enjoying the beauty of all HK and the seas all around you from the roof top is amazing experience. The hotel is quite reasonable also and does have all types of foods including limited Indian food also and food quality and taste is good. Something which I didn't like was the fact that at times you might have to wait if you arrive a little before the check-in time, so plan and call them beforehand to avoid waiting at reception. In the end I would like to mention that this is a hotel worth staying in so do give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “all that”
Reviews.Author: doubleluckydonkey
Reviews.Content: it's all good at East. even scored an unsolicited courtesy upgrade to a corner room. sweetness. rooftop bar may be too-cool-for-school if you're a bit of a geezer or come from peasant stock. guilty on both counts.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Chic and worth the value!”
Reviews.Author: FreshSugar
Reviews.Content: East Hong Kong Hotel was actually our back up hotel when Mandarin Oriental and Grand Hyatt were fully booked for an expo - and we are so glad we ended up staying at EAST!!! PROS: + Great, friendly service. everyone was so helpful! + Next to the City Plaza. The hotel is connected by a skybridge to a mall - great if you need a quick bite + Fast check in & check out + Literately next to the Tai Koo MTR station, about a 5 second walk. It's 4 stations away from Causeway Bay (where alot of the shopping malls are on the island). It looks like a long way on google map, but it's actually not far at all! + Got an upgrade to the Urban Corner Room! :) It was very nice, but we heard the Harbour view rooms are the best - definitely going to book Harbor view next time. + FREE wireless internet in our room + the hotel is relatively new, unlike a lot of dated hotels situated at Causeway Bay. + quiet area + rooms were modern, clean and comfortable + room service was fast & friendly - New York Rueben Steak Sandwich was amazing! ordered it twice! + love the big windows in our room! + electronic blinds + ipod touch in every room loaded with great music. my favorite playlist: modern hiphop CONS + the design of the room is probably not best for families - you don't get much privacy. The wall to the shower is see-through, so if you are by the bed, you can see into the shower. Also not great for friends staying in the same room. Overall, great price, great stay and perfect for couples or if you are on business!

Reviews.Title: “East is East”
Reviews.Author: Dezzydez
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed here twice and might be a third time next month if we can secure competitive rates. Both stays have been in a superior cityview room. The room has a natural minimalist feel, compact and open plan with a glass screen seperating the sink, wetroom and toilet. The storage is well thought out and eveything is shoehorned in and hidden away - electronic safe, ironing board, hairdryer, various adaptors. Fixtures are generally solid, good quality bed and mattress and room is well soundproofed. Location is far from Central though. At least 25 mins on subway, so if you need to cross over to Kowloon alot, you will feel the extra journey time if you are used to staying in CWB/Admiralty. Upside is the15 to 20% disclount you get of pre paid and you know you will get a modern, well designed hotel. Its a dependable choice. Lots of local eats in the immediate area. Use the subway to walk to the Jusco department store - really good Japanese supermarket and small restaurants. We liked the ramen bar called Santokou. Also the huge mall next to hotel has a cheap eat section that had a huge variety of an asian food stalls. It was clean and reasonably priced. Sugar Bar on top of hotel has amazing terrace and views across Victoria harbour. East is dependable choice as long as you don't mind the compact size and distance from Central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oenographer
Reviews.Content: I just spent 8 nights at the EAST hotel in Hong Kong, joined by colleagues for five nights, and our experience was exceptionally good. The omnipresent Swire group has opened in the east part of Hong Kong an exceptional business hotel at very competitive prices, but one with that extra touch to please its guests. True, the hotel is a bit far from Central as the bird flies, but in fact it only takes 10 minutes to get there by MTR (the station is literally next to the hotel) or taxi (depending on the traffic). A short walk will take you to the old fashioned tramway for a longer but oh so picturesque journey into the city. The immediate area around the hotel has plenty of shopping malls with shops such as Muji and Uniqlo, and restaurants including the excellent Peking Garden. The rooms are quite large, many with stunning views of Kowloon. Very comfortable beds, powerful shower spray, discreet but very attentive young staff. Very good restaurant for all three meals, including a varied breakfast menu with a large choice of delicious juices. The hotel must be doing well because the restaurant was packed for breakfast everyday at different times, but never to the point where one had to wait. On the roof is a very trendy and popular bar called Sugar, with the great view of Kowloon. Highly recommended, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Different but good”
Reviews.Author: cpda58
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to be a boutique hotel - this seems to catch all phrase when things are done differently - staff in a casual uniform, toilets without doors (single rooms), room service in paper bags..... The service was excellent - very attentive and friendly staff. Spotless hotel, excellent amenities, a bed that was just right, not too soft/hard. TV choice was not very good with channels mainly in Chinese. Adequate plug points and lighting, fast internet service. Toilet with no door took some getting used to, didn't particularly like it. The shower was messy - again no door or curtain. Room service food was delicious, though I did not like eating out of an "eco-friendly" paper bag. Roof top bar has a fantastic view and relaxing ambiance. One coffee shop and no other restaurant. All in all I liked the hotel mainly because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “love it !!”
Reviews.Author: nick_ng
Reviews.Content: The first word that came to me as I walked in was ".. this place's got character .." All the positives that have been mentioned about EAST are true. This is the hotel to stay when you are in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a hotel in Hong Kong, Go East!”
Reviews.Author: SYLEONG
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here as my office is in the Taikooshing area so it was very convenient for me. After the Airport Express train, I walked over to Island Line of the MTR and took the subway directly to Taikoo station, walked to exit D1 and EAST is right in front of the exit! I had some trouble finding the hotel at first because there were no signs indicating where East was when you come out of the exit but luckily Janice at the front desk gave me excellent directions over the phone and I was soon checking in. A big thank you to her for her professionalism and service during the check in process and she was also very helpful in providing directions in the surrounding areas. EAST is located right smack next to Cityplaza which will satisfy all your shopping demands. Sugar bar on the 32nd floor is a must see if you are in the area as the view over the harbor at night is quite intoxicating! Another shout out to Tweety, I think that's the name of my server in Sugar, who was so friendly and professional in her service, that it was easy to feel relaxed here. So kudos to EAST for having inculcated such warm and friendly service to their people. Will definitely stay here again, but ask for a harbor facing room next time!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Chic East”
Reviews.Author: Prash_One
Reviews.Content: Cannot spot the location as it's right next to the Metro- Very trendy and chic hotel with very very comfortable beds and a nice view of Hong King @ Night. The breakfast buffet was exceptional with fresh juices (Red Berry, Kiwi Fruit), Croissants etc. I also visited the Sky Lounge and the view from there was real good. Not much to do in Tai Koo except that of a mall and a couple of restaurants but since the metro was literally next door, commuting was smooth. The rooms were very tidy and also had an Ipod for music. The bathroom and shower was extremely satisfactory. I highly recommend- The EAST, HONG KONG.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, easy, great location”
Reviews.Author: GreenOcean
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice in December on business. Hotel is located near my office though not in the central CBD. It is very convenient to travel by the subway that is right next to the hotel. A hugh shopping mall with lot of retaurants and shops also next to the Hotel. Room is bright, fresh and clean. I like the ipod in the room and the Sugar Bar at the penthouse. Beware of the writing table edges, it is a bit sharp.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and room”
Reviews.Author: bobo2003
Reviews.Content: best hotel in town, good room size, modern, friendly staff. rain shower is exotic, bed is comfy...will definitely come back to this hotel, we booked for 2 nights with harbour view, which is beautiful. free wifi is a plus. this is a business hotel, definitely not for a family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Business Hotel; more like a Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fhyr
Reviews.Content: Room was small; only 2 electrical plugs in room; 1 at desk and 1 next to side of bed. Glass shower door; no room to change after shower except in tiny open area outside of shower where sink is and where everyone can see you. I had to take my showers in the morning when everyone else was still asleep so they wouldn't see me naked! When going to the bathroom at night, I turn on the lights so I can see and the whole room lights up, disturbing everyone else in the room. Water from sink splashes all over and onto the floor; spout should be further into the sink. Toilet is encased in glass; door has a small gap, so does not even close tight. Tiny closet; not enough hangers; I counted only about 5. There was no coffee or tea in our room; just a coffee pot for making coffee and a pot for boiling water. There were 3 of us in a room (Urban View) with a rollaway and a queen bed. Rollaway only fit in front of all the drawers, so every time something was needed from the drawer, the rollaway bed had to be moved. Room might be good for just 1 person.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Efficiency”
Reviews.Author: destroubadours
Reviews.Content: Only a year old, EAST is indeed located east of most of Hong Kong island’s happening places and tourist hotspots, but at approximately ten meters from the entrance to the Tai Koo MTR station and a stone’s throw from all the fun of Quarry Bay, its guests don’t have much reason to miss the chaos of downtown. The hotel is beautiful, with the most gorgeous lobby we’ve ever seen. The staff are all dressed in simple grey-green sweaters and black Converse: easily identified but nothing stuffy here! They all also wear permanent, genuine smiles and are, without a doubt, the most efficient hotel personnel we’ve ever encountered, from check-in, the pool, the bar, and the front-desk phone, through to the astoundingly quick 2-minute check-out. We dealt pretty extensively with behind-the-scenes staff, as well, for reservations, questions, and a follow-up on our stay: needless to say, they wowed us equally. But our minds were truly blown by the room itself! Space in Hong Kong is always at a premium, of course, so the room is small. But who would know it? Clearly a lot of effort went into the interior design, and it shows. The bathroom vanity is separated from the bed by a semi-transparent, partial wall and mirror, so the space is separated enough for a feeling of privacy, but continues to feel open and spacious. The bed is oh-so-fluffy and comfortable and the rain shower a pure delight. Other pros: Great view from the 32nd floor bar, Sugar. Great gym equipment and a heated, outdoor pool. Simple card tap access for rooms and the elevator, a perfect balance between security and simplicity. Door-to-door airport shuttle for half the price of the Airport Express train with limousine-style seats and on-time service. Other cons: Our only disappointment was the food. The in-room coffee was truly substandard and undrinkable. The bar nibbles at Sugar also fell short of the mark, but a follow-up by the hotel (less than 24-hours after our check-out) gives us faith that they’ll be working that out pronto. Verdict: Forget trying to find the right hotel downtown. Hop the MTR and stay at EAST. On our next trip to Hong Kong, we won’t be looking at anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel at great value”
Reviews.Author: Albal22
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights. Excellent hotel for the price paid. Refurbished rooms and a modern design. Location is at North Point which means 15 min drive off-peak to the Central and 30-45 min at rush hours. Restaurant service is below average.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish, young and friendly in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Ad4m
Reviews.Content: Located 30 secs from Tai Koo MTR, this hotel is in a great loaction for those who would like to be part of the busy Hong Kong night life yet escape the noise of the street at the end of the night, it took approx 13 minutes to Causeway Bay, 20 to Central and 27 to Mong Kok.
