The hotel also has a roof top bar, 300ft above sea level and offers some fantastic views of the harbour. Was here slightly longer than planned (thanks to the snow closing Heathrow) and helpfulness of the staff in rebooking me at such sort notice was much appreciated. Was in 2 different rooms on oppostie side of the building during my stay here and thought both were great. Both were urban views but on the corners so had a two walls of glass. In room amenities included the standard Tea, Coffee (Philips Senseo) facilities, mini bar, snacks, hair dryer, Iron + board, walk in shower (with rain head), desk, TV (hidden behind a picture of Kowloon bay), Free WiFi, LAN, ability to hook up your laptop to the TV through VGA/HDMI/RGB, Ipod Touch with basic preloaded information on the area and music and a docking station if to play it through (bonus if you bring you own Touch). A taxi to Central should cost around HKD65, which to me is a bargain. Lots of places to eat locally (unfortunately didn't find these until near the end of my trip) around the base of the housing blocks and the hotel is next door to City Plaza (with its own walk way under construction) which is the biggest mall on HK island, with numerous shops, restaurants and a food hall, where lunch can be as little as HKD30. Well, with all that positveness you may be asking what about the things that wern't so great? Well I didnt' eat much from the hotel apart from some late night room service, once for breakfast and 2 evening meals (no need to when so much choice around eleswhere) but I was not overly impressed. The restaurant is nicely presented but I suppose I just expected better food given the relative prices and what they are trying to acheive. Overall... Defintiely a positive place and worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravel089
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with young kids. Reception was excellent, when we arrived at around 6pm, room was not available. (non-smoking with 2 beds). They made an effort to find one for us and finally gave us a king size bed with one extra bed(free of charge). I like the coffee maker and ipod system. The urban designed hotel is up to date and we like it very much. Compare to other standard hotel in HK, the room is considered big for family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexchan88
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 10 nights. Service was excellent. We reserved the Harbour View room. The view was extraordinary (both day and night). Everyone working there are young, energetic and polite. Location is great, immediately next to MTR (subway) station entrance. Next door is a big shopping mall with a lot of restaurants. Also need to mention is the design of the door to each room, it closes very quitely. For the whole stay we have not heard of a single slamming door closing from neighboring rooms. It is the quietest hotel I have ever stayed at. This is very important.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek hotel with a few nice surprises”
Reviews.Author: global_alexander
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while travelling solo on business. Handy location with big mall and MTR station close by. Pretty good hotel gym and outdoor pool and handy to the harbour park for an outside run (if you can handle the smog). Loved the ipod dock by the bed and the shower is awesome. Hidden flat screen TV also a plus for those who don't like a room dominated by a TV. Requested (and got) a room with a view of the harbour on level 20. Gorgeous, but let down by the venetian blinds which can't be drawn. A small frustration. Breakfast buffet is pretty good, but strangely it includes as much juice as you like, but no cold filtered water, which was an unnecessary annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SylvMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The East Hotel is an excellent business hotel, room size is small but perfect for solo travellers. The rooms are new and fresh, beds are divine and the shower is awesome. Hotel has free internet connection and when you order room service your food comes packaged in neat boxes in a bag, not sure why this is so except perhaps for eating on the run - I get the breakfast but not sure how this is supposed to work for dinner. On the 32nd floor is the Sugar bar which overlooks Hong Kong city the views are short of spectacular on a clear night. You sit in an outdoor area which is surrounded by walls of glass while music chills everybody out on the sofas & bean bags. Definately the place to go after dinner. Shopping is handy next door in the City Plaza which has a good mix of shops. I loved it because this hotel is new, different, edgy and cool and looking forward to coming back on future business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place but”
Reviews.Author: gd3110
Reviews.Content: I liked the place especially because it is right next to my office in City Plaza. I agree with most comments .. Adding my 2 pennies... The ipod touch in rooms is nothing more than a gimmick , it a jaulbroken peice of crap with only weather , stock and a hotel directory... It would have been great if they had enabled Safari, Skype & you tube duh!! i made the mistake of leaving mine at home ;( , the saving grace for the hotel was that they let you borrow a laptop for 3 hours at a time .. Pretty neat The staff is very nice and courteous .. Ahould be an obvious choice if you will be working out of Taikoo / CityPlaza

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Newer Business Hotel with GREAT FOOD!!!”
Reviews.Author: exotik
Reviews.Content: We had a corner view urban view on floor 20. Unfortunately, we were not selected for harborview upgrade. Urban view was ok. Room was really small, yet efficient, and nice appearance. This hotel is in the Tai Koo Shing Road area which has a huge shopping mall a short block away. The MTR (metro/subway) is clean and exit/entrance is almost next door. The buffet was the best part as I am a picky eater. There were nice selections from the menu as well, but I mainly ate the buffet. I do recommend this hotel. It is easy to get to and from. On the east side of Hong Kong near the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Uber Cool and So Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Jen067
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, the East is an amazing hotel. The staff are absolutely fantastic and the hotel itself is an uber cool, trendy and contemporary venue. We loved this place: the room (Urban view room) was first class; so was the gym and the 'Sugar' bar/lounge on the 32nd floor (views across the harbour were awesome). The main asset of this hotel is the staff. They hold doors open for you, they are polite, respectful and genuinely wanted to help you. This is a welcome trait in today's modern world. The Tai Koo MTR is literally a short walk away (i.e. 1 minute) which makes this hotel ideally placed to base yourself in `HK'. Loved the East to bits. Absolutely no hesitation in recommending it to anyone. This is not just a business hotel. Truly was a pleasure staying here

Reviews.Title: “This is what hotels should be like”
Reviews.Author: bassman62
Reviews.Content: East is a fabulous hotel whether you are staying for business or holiday. The rooms are new and the design is sleek and well laid out. The bed is among the most comfortable I have slept in and the shower is absolutely brilliant. Two items that are very important for an enjoyable stay. But the best thing about the hotel is the service. From front of house reception to housekeeping, bar and restaurant the service is king here and they look after their guests with great efficiency and courtesy. The location is towards the east side of Hong Kong island but the MTR station is right next to the hotel and you are in Central or Wan Chai in 15 20 minutes. There is also a beautiful shopping mall, CityPlaza next to the hotel as well. All in all a great hotel experience and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: ree646
Reviews.Content: this was a new hotel when i visited hk for work. my manager who lives there reccomended it because it was near the office and looked nice and trendy. i was here for 4 nights and i really enjoyed staying here. its right next door to the train station and a mall. the pool looked nice although i didnt get a chance to use it. the roof top bar was really nice.. nice bartender... great view! the service was great too... the people at the reception helped me with where to go to eat, sight see etc a lot! i fell sick on this trip and needed to stay back for an extra night and they were very helpful with checking me back into my room quickly. great service, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic new hotel, amazing harbourviews!”
Reviews.Author: Lauratraveladdict
Reviews.Content: I booked the cheapest room, was given an upgrade to a harbourview room upon checkin, the view was to die for! Spectacular harbour, amazing lights and buildings that went on forever. Great area, next door to a massive shoping centre (City Plaza), next door to the MTR which you can take to anywhere in the island. I'm definitely staying there when I go for my next business trip! And leisure trip! The rooftop bar is fantastic as well!

Reviews.Title: “Urban hip hotel - some awkwards”
Reviews.Author: Pearlie_76
Reviews.Content: Very clean, no frill, simple, and trendy hotel. Staff are very young and they get to wear very cool uniforms for a hotel staff (shirts and sneakers). The MTR is just beside the hotel thus an advantage for those travelling on business meeting in HK and may have limited time to sight-see. Though the i-pod is a cool gadget to have in the hotel, uploaded are very few appealing selection for me. In the end, I didn't find this 'handy' and 'a plus' at all. The TV is located a bit awkward from the big comfy bed. Had to move adjust the desklamp just to get a good view of the TV. The shower room which did not a door is a bit a surprise. A different experience for a hotel guest. May be pleasant for some, but may be a bit awkward for typical Asians. Don't mind staying again. In fact, back again next week.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doydy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, service was good. The room we got is the harbour view room at the 21st floor and the view is great. Room comes with free wifi and and Ipod where in you can check some info about the hotel, check your bill, even order room service. The downside to the hotel is the location, as the area is mostly residential condo but there's also a 7-11 and Wellcome nearby. Pros: Free wifi (slow but can't really complain, its free) Rain Shower Ipod Espresso Machine MTR is just next door City Plaza is also next door Room Service Food is place in take away box Motorized Curtain Cons: Sink - worst design of the hotel See thru shower door Location

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel w/ great convenience”
Reviews.Author: AHA2006
Reviews.Content: Traveled for business in July and company is nearby. Given an high floor corner urban view with a density of high rises w/ mountains in the background. Plus, all windows are ceiling to floor with generous lightings to the room, to me it was a more attractive view than the harbour view. Couldn't help staring outside the window all the time. Interior design is tasteful, and I like the informality of staff uniform with a youthful and casual look. Staff are very service oriented and when you need something, you get it right away. Breakfast is also high quality with both western and Chinese breakfast offered. The fact that it's right next to a big mall and all the office buildings, plus the subway station, even though it is hot and humid in HK in July, it made the stay very comfortable. Even if you just visit or stay there, should check out the top floor bar called Feast. We had drinks up there with some friends and it has great views and comfy couches.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MRGLondon
Reviews.Content: East HK is near my Hong Kong office so i have stayed there 4 times in the past few months. i have noticed that the size of my room and the quality of the view has gradually worsened after each visit, I am not sure i can risk staying one more time as i doubt they can have a smaller room than the last one they gave me. location is good for business, restaurant is OK, gym and pool areas are great and there is a nice rooftop bar. however the finishings look quite cheap and less than 6 months after the opening things are already falling apart. they are also not very thorough cleaning the toilet areas. the beds are extremely comfortable though! to recap, OK hotel to spend a couple of nights as long as not a lot of time is spent inside the room as it can get claustrophobic

Reviews.Title: “New designer hotel in the up and coming East End of HK Island”
Reviews.Author: HeikoMaximilian
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended newcomer in HKs hotel landscape (Swire Group), ideal for those who don't have to (or want to) stay right in Central. It's only a 15-minute subway ride from all the action in/around Central and it offers brand new desgnier luxury and comfort at very competitive rates (for HK standards). Rooms are larger than average, and very well furnished. Staff is extra friendly yet not 100% professional (stayed there 1 month after the official opening, thats probably why). Would certainly stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, modern appeal, good value”
Reviews.Author: Steeevyo
Reviews.Content: East is a brand new Hotel located in Taikoo area of Hong Kong. About 10 minutes ride to Central with the Subway which is located conveniently right next to the Hotel. The Hotel being east of Causeway Bay really doesn't matter in the slightest. Also if you're in the Center late night just take a 80 HKD Taxi ride and it will get you there in no time. This was our second stay and this time we were upgraded to a corner harbor view room which had a great view over to the old airport. The room is modern and compact. No signs of wear to be found. Nice Shower and single vanity. Storage space sufficient for two. Nice bathrobes. Some criticism on the room: You have to move the desk lamp in order to watch TV from the bed and the toilet door should be a bit more soundproof (even if you stay with your partner as in my case) instead of being frosted glass with wide gaps leaving no acoustic privacy whatsoever. Also it takes too long to open all the inside louvers as they are not motorized. All this didn't affect our stay here at all but it should be mentioned as these are not issues with the hotels category but simply some omissions during planning stage. The Gym is big with lockers and huge changing rooms. And service is very nice and forthcoming. Also I especially enjoyed the outside pool. The staff is young but very professional and forthcoming. We got assistance for our trip to Macau and all other requests were dealt with promptly and in a flawless manner. To summarize if you like a modern and boutique-ish appeal in a hotel and you also look for good value I think this Hotel in Hong Kong perfectly fills that niche. We enjoyed it a lot and we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent Hotel I have stayed so far.”
Reviews.Author: Orks_2020
Reviews.Content: it is located directly in front of the Tai Koo MTR station D1 exit. it is right beside City Plaza mall. Jusco mall exit 'C'. The lobby is neat and quiet. The staff are well trained and speak english very well. You need to tap the key card on the elevator sensor before you can select your floor. I was given an 'Urban-view' room (2715), meaning tall buildings no ocean view. The room size is ok but i would prefer it a little bit bigger. The room is very clean & neat. very modern in lay-out & equipment, furnishings are trendy and complete, LCD TV, Ref, coffee maker & coffee, Kettle & several tea bags, sugar & creamer, 2 bottled water, iron & iron board, Hair dryer, umbrella, 2 bathrobes, 6 hangers. 3 towels, 3 mid-towels, 3 face towels, 2 toothbrush & toothpaste,1 shower cap, 1 shaver & shaving cream, vanity kit, Liquid hand soap, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, liquid body soap, paper & pen, pad & pencil, electric plug adaptor, video cables, svga computer cables (laptop video output to Lcd tv), rca cables, Lan cable, ipod & ipod speaker/clock dock. adjustable study lamp on the leather-topped table. 2 Glow sticks, shoe brush, 2 slippers & pouch. laundry bag. master lights off switch on Both side of the bed (either me or my wife can close the lights), Free WI-FI 24/7. cable tv. what it don't have is a dvd player & a massager chair. it has only 2 electrical outlet in the room (study table & 1 bedside). the water faucet position & sink table shape is not user friendly (water will always get spilled over). Tai Koo is a little bit out of the way (more travel time involved getting around Hong Kong)

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Williamfatcute
Reviews.Content: First thing notice was the shabby uniforms the staff wore. Lime green tops that looked worn out. It was not a good first impresion. The rooms are decent. However the open walk in shower has design flaw and the water leaks on the main bathroom area Which is unpleasant. The tv has good channels and there is a big shopping mall next door. The bar on the top floor has a good vibe. Its a good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, a little sterile, overlooked by high rise”
Reviews.Author: ambochick
Reviews.Content: On holiday, not business, we chose to stay at EAST because it's new and expected (and got) good quality bedding and shower, it's as simple as that. There's not much atmosphere here, and a leaning toward frugality. EAST has corporate stamped all over it, the food is rather expensive, fine for debiting the old firm, but not the tourist's budget. On the food, I'm sure they are still finding their way, and need to scale down the trendy factor- i refuse to eat steak off a wooden chopping board (unhygenic) and requested china. The buffet selection whilst faultlessly fresh is limited , is not cheap for the price, and seafood rationed out by the chef, because EAST are getting at you. Top floor bar is unreliable in opening hours for any type of tapas etc. and they need to address this. Bar crowded in the evening with non staying Walk across the road to a shopping mall containing a lovely french restaurant among others. Although young and hip we found the staff aimiable and eager to please. It's easy to commute five or so stops to Central by train, although EAST has some sort of expensive pick up service available. We were upgraded (there's a first for everything) to the corner suite. Really beautiful, if a little cramped, and the funny thing was so unexpected, two walls of glass overlooking the mostly smog ridden harbour but being totally and extremely closely overlooked on both sides, by many huge residential high rises.(if you miss that fact there's the note on the window to warn you of onlookers) All up we got what we wanted, a sterile environment, small, clean, neat and comfortable, great mattress and linen, quality products, surrounded by good shops and train station. Just wish the boss was paying for it.

Reviews.Title: “Book this if your office is in Taikoo Place. Good for Tourist wanting cheap luxury + a little local taste”
Reviews.Author: WatchingTVintheHotel
Reviews.Content: I spend a few days in every week of June 2010 in EAST. Like many business tarvellers who are booked here, our HK office is in Taikoo. The hotel location is convenient to stroll into Taikoo Place which houses a host of MNCs. Being right at the doorstep of CityPlaza shoping centre and the Taikoo MTR entrance would be a plus for many tourist. If your office is in Central, while HK is small, it does feel like forever braving the morning office crowd on the MTR given there are many other hotels closer to Central (ie. Causeway, Admiralty, WanChai areas). The hotel is located within the Taikoo Shing residential estate, so a peer out the windows would be your average middle-class HK household. Even from the 28th floor harbour view, I couldn't leave the window blinds open to enjoy the harbour view. As the hotel is new, everything is still gleaming and there is a quiet luxurious feel to the rooms. See-through bath areas, in-room wifi that works, ordering room service from your in-room iPod - this makes the room slightly more interested each day as you discover these gadgets. The gym and pool is adequate. 24-hours gym is a great plus. Room service is decently (portions and price) and fast - one page menu that covers the basics. Suits the fact that most business travellers stay less than 1 week and hop out of HK. A few travellers complained there was no place to put the luggage. This is a problem with these new rooms with the "ledge seats" to free up space in the room - use that for the luggage if you are travelling alone! A good choice if your offices is farther in the East or especially in the Taikoo area (cab into Central from EAST is approximately HK$60). Or for travellers wanting to get more comfort out of their dollar. For these travellers, the current rates would be a better choice than the Harbour Plaza North Point, City Garden, or even the other hotels that are at the fringe end of Causeway Bay. Overall, quick and reasonably priced, with a hint of class. Very typical Swire offering. Plus you get the meet the locals !

Reviews.Title: “New hotel with young inexperienced staff-just okay stay”
Reviews.Author: MelBNolan
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at the EAST hotel. I was there on business, our Hong Kong offices are within walking distance of the EAST hotel, which is the only reason that I would stay at the EAST given the plethera of hotel choices in Hong Kong. I found the staff to be pleasant but very young and inexperienced. I ate breakfast every morning in the hotel's restaurant which was pleasant enough but found the service to be a bit spotty. I had a standard room which was compact and very efficiently designed to maximise space, except there was no place to put my suitcase. The room had an open plan with the bathroom integrated into the overall room design. This would have been okay had there been an exhaust fan in the shower to help remove the steam. There was no place for the steam to escape so it ended up in bedroom, which in a city that is already hot and humid was not ideal. Fortunately the hotel is close to the subway. Very mediocre shopping and restaurants in the immediate area surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good addition to the HK hotel market”
Reviews.Author: BK-1K
Reviews.Content: I found East to be a very nice hotel in Hong Kong with the highlight being its overall value for the money. I prefer less trendy hotels - East is like a lower budget "W" hotel - where the focus is on being cool and loud music. But I also freely admit that the quality of the rooms and the food at the restaurant here at East were very good. The rooms have comfortable beds and good wifi. I don't like the "open bathroom" concept - but it seems to be catching on with trendy hotel design these days. The gym is also quite good. Note that if you are looking for a hotel closer to the CBD, keep looking - East is not that well situated for typical business travelers (but very close to my company's offices in HK).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent high-tech business hotel @ Tai Koo Place.”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: I spent a total of 3 nights at the East hotel, over two separate stays. Like many of the newer hotels in Hong Kong, this hotel is ULTRA high-tech. Check in is fast and only needed once (great for when you have to check-out for a inter-asia trip and then back in a few days later). The hotel staff is very polite, efficient, and ready to help with most any request. The rooms are on the smaller side (by western standards) but I found for a single traveler that they were more than large enough. The showers are nearly perfect in anyway, and after a 15 hour flight from the US they are very welcome indeed. The hotel is located @ Tai Koo MTR stop (exit D1) and is walking distance to many of the major business centers on the eastern part of Hong Kong Island. The room-service menu is small but of high-quality. If you are looking for a respite from the local food, EAST makes a pretty mean club-sandwich. The only thing keeping me from awarding 5 stars is that I feel that Hotels need to be compared to other hotels in the city... and Hong Kong has some classic high-end hotels to compete. That being said, you can't go wrong with EAST (especially if you need to be near that part of the island).

Reviews.Title: “a trendy hotel, friendly staff - but location isnt great if you need to be in central”
Reviews.Author: JONMCINERN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in may, the rooms are very trendy, and the bed exceptionally comfortable, also the itouch in the room has a great selection of music. Staff are friendly, and service is very good and efficient. The hotel also has an excellent roof top bar that offers great views over the eastern part of victoria harbour, the drinks arent cheap but HK isnt a cheap place. Music is excellent, and the tapas selection has lots of tasty snacks to help to absorb the drink! Wifi is free too. On the down side, I was working in central, and this involved an 8 stop tube ride on the MTR from tai koo to central, the MTR station is next to the hotel and the journey time is probably between 15 to 20 mins, which would be fine if I was on holiday, but it was a pain for me as I was effectively doing a commute. I would recommend this to people coming to HK on holiday who want a bit of luxury but not the costs, its not the best location as its slightly outside the centre of town, but its only a 55 hkd taxi ride home from central (about 5 gbp) and for a short visit its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Triumph of fussy style over good sense”
Reviews.Author: TakeBigBites_Slowly
Reviews.Content: The East makes much of its "Zen" decor. The guest is apparently supposed to sit quietly in his room and meditate on its austere beauty. Or something like that. In practice, this means the room has one chair -- a second person may sit on a minimalist built-in shelf, his back against the unpadded wall, facing the smoked-glass partition that shields the sink and loo. I hadn't noticed the thin pad on the shelf (which makes it a seat, instead of a shelf) because my suitcase was there. This seat was pointed out to me by the East's "Hotel Experience Manager". When I asked where I could find the luggage cradle, the Hotel Experience Manager (I'm not making this up) told me there wasn't one. It spoils the decor. The Hotel Experience Manager was in my room to discuss the half-glass of red wine that I spilled on the carpet a few nights previous. Although I soaked it up with a towel, the hotel claimed they could not clean it, and wanted to charge me $1500 to "replace the carpet". The (non-cleanable) carpet, it seems, is part of the experience. The wineglass hit the floor because the tiny Zen tables on either side of the bed are crowded with electronic gizmos (on one side) and the phone (on the other). When I balked at this inane fee, the East reduced it to $1000 (HKD). The value isn't bad for the money, if you don't mind having to tiptoe around your room, being careful not to disturb its Feng Shui. The restaurant menu is uninspired, but there are other places to eat in the vicinity. And the staff are generally gracious. Pity about the over-precious decor. I certainly won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy and fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: LondonAVB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights on business. Very modern and only been open 2-3 months. Great rooms with everything you need. View from anything other than the top couple of floors isn't great but few in HK are. Location is ideal if you are working in quarry bay not so if you need to get to central. However MTR is cheap and quick, taxis about HK$60. Overall a great find of a hotel and good value

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: tripmonkey12
Reviews.Content: Fantastic new hotel. Stayed on a high floor which provided great views of the city and harbor despite the clouds. Very nice decor and modern touches. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Services and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: zhang_yuz
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a half business half leisure trip. I stayed in this hotel per my company booker's suggestion. Great location as my company is in TaiKoo Place - a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Rooms are gracefully designed, love the iPod in room (a lot of soundtracks included). Something like W but not as funky as them. Personal touches from the reception and the bar made my stay an enjoyable one. Go look for Jerard from reception. I asked him about dinner recommendations and he gave me a "three-days in Hong Kong itinerary" advice - genuine hospitality services that I hadn't received in Hong Kong for a while. Nowadays, hotels receptionists tend to focus on the computer all the time but this hotel's receptionists are all young and bright. Also, Love the GYM that opened all hours. Great value for money overall. Will bring in more clients and business partners there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: TripFrequent
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for 1 week. Both rooms have a bad odor that would not go away. At first I did not know what smell that was, later on found out it's the same smell as the water fountain at the entrance of the hotel. It tends to get worst at night. I complained to the front desk. They said they would send someone up to check. Waited for 1 hour and no people. I went down to the front desk and compained. When I got back from dinner, they said the room smell was from food. I do not even have food in the room. They did not offer us to switch room but just offered to put an air purifier in. The last day of the stay, the fire alarm was off at 7:00 am in the morning. All guests were confused and waited at the hallway. There was no announcement at all from the hotel. I called down the reception but got a busy signal. Hotel has no fire alarm protocal at all. It ended up it was somebody smoking in the hotel, per a guest from another room who was able to talk to someone downstair. Location is excellent, but the service needs to be improved. Especially the strange smell in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel, really good value”
Reviews.Author: amazingrice
Reviews.Content: This is like a mini version of W Hotel with the same "hippness". Officially opened end of Jan 2010. Rooms are modern and the beds are really comfortable with black out curtains. LOVE LOVE the ipod provided which had the hotel guest greeting message in it along with a variety of playlists and hotel info. I am a sucker for this stuff! Plus totally appreciate that the key cards were the "tap" kind instead of ones where you have to flip back and forth to insert on the right side. And FREE wi-fi everywhere, which is rare in hotels these days. A must to take an ocean view room or you will be seeing old men in their boxers in the residential building across staring at you staring at him. Gym is well equipped and 24hrs and there is a nice sized pool to swim in. Location is convenient as in the MTR is right next door but it's actually in the middle of a white collar/family residential/advertising agency office complex. Kind of an odd crowd when you walk out but the plus is that there are plenty of nice restaurants and supermarkets nearby. You can get anywhere quite efficiently with the MTR. Did not get a chance to try out their resturant but I saw a nice buffet going on and the bar/lounge on the top floor Sugar was quite happening. Nice view and atmosphere for a nite-cap. Overall, great hotel which makes it very good value for money esp in comparison to their sister hotel in Admiralty. I would definately return. Only downside is you can really hear housekeeping going at it at 7:30 in the morning. Also be aware, they are quite serious about their 4pm check in so request early check in or else you would be hanging out in the park across :).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Chiq Hotel at a decent price with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Johnl617
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at this hotel for work. I've stayed at a bunch of 5 star hotels in the Wan Chai area but they were not as trendy as this hotel. The Room - I booked the Harbour View which was nice, I dont see the big difference between this and the neighborhood view. If you dont walk around your room naked, I dont see the problem why you wouldnt want to save some money. The company paid for it, so I booked the best one. :) The Itouch/IHome was a nice touch. I was able to use my own iphone to play my music. The lcd or plasma tv is hidden behind a painting that slides. I like that. Pretty ninja-like. The bed is comfy with no slumps. THE ONLY 2 CONS - Shower - There is a damp mossy smell in my shower. I think its from the materials used to build the shower room. The smell goes away once I start showering. its not a big deal. Faucet - I hate this faucet. Its built in such a bad way. Everytime I wash my hand, face, etc, the water splashes everywhere. Looked like I peed in my pants. Its some sort of design flaw. FEAST - I got free breakfast every morning. Their hot items are nice. The cold buffet items are good. I ate smoked salmon and drank fresh juices everyday. The fresh juices was the best part of this restaurant. They had strawberry, kiwi, oj, guave, berries, and grapefruit juices. ALL FRESH AND NOT FROM CONCENTRATE. Overall - Great Hotel. Fix the damn faucets.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in HK”
Reviews.Author: samandjet
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with family members from Taiwan, we had 4 rooms in total. Rooms are not big, but you can find everything you need in a hotel. Comfy chair to work on, all the connection from your laptop to TV, iPod, coffee machine, amazing bedding and totally blackout rollerblind. Shower in regular queen bedded rooms works better (with a glass door) which means the whole bathroom doesnt get wet from a shower and it's not as cold as the corner rooms. View from harbour rooms are indeed very nice. Location is interesting, which is about 15 min to Central, but the hotel is right next to a subway entrance. And you can find everything you need in CityPlaza (big shopping mall with a nice size food court, Muji to H&M). Service: Service is friendly and efficient both at front desk and restaurant! Restaurant and bar: Had breakfast a few times at FEAST and value for money is great consider it's HK. Don't forget to have drinks up in Sugar!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, brand new hotel with some rough edges”
Reviews.Author: sant0224
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Swire's other two properties in Asia, the Opposite House and the Upper House and are tempted to compare the three hotels. But to be fair to East Hotel, we should review it on its own merits. We stayed in East Hotel for six nights, in two different categories of rooms, the Harbour Queen and the Urban Corner room. Mixed feelings is how we would like to describe this hotel. On the plus side, it is a brand new hotel located at a residential district with almost everything you need, like restaurants, supermarkets and shops of all kinds. The design is striking without being overwhelming to the visual sense. The check-in and restaruant staff are friendly and eager to help, though the guys responsible for security at the entrance may look a bit coolish and distant. Both categories of rooms have all the amenities you would expect in a four-star hotel. Both are of a good size. It is very good that wi-fi and local calls are complimentary. The bed and the pillows are comfy and the writing desk is of the right size. The complimentary nougat and the iHome system are nice touches. Of course, the unobstructed harbour view in the Harbour Queen room is superb! East Hotel would have received an unreserved thumbs-up from us but for a few misses which we think inconvenienced our stay. First, we could not switch on the lights in the toilet without switching on all the main lights in the room, thanks to the rather unconventional lighting system. This means that, every morning, I had to turn all the light on for shaving and washing while my partner was still asleep. Just imagine how annoying this could be. Second, there is only one chair in the room. That would not have been a problem if there had been a single guest. With two guests staying, it would be inevitable for one of us to sit on the bed, which we were quite reluctant to do for hygiene reasons. This may sound like our quirk, but we believe that both rooms were big enough for at least a stool of some sort. (We did, in fact, request a second chair, but were told the hotel had none!) Third, there is no glass partition in the shower area in the Urban Corner room. I know that this is design adopted in some hotels (including the Upper House), but it did not seem to work in a compact room because, with only one airconditioning/heating area control, it was not possible to have a shower without feeling cold. (It was rather unfortunate that there was a cold spell during our stay.) East Hotel is overall a good hotel. We would definitely stay there again. But we would also love to see the hotel do something to make their guests' stay even more comfortable and memorable.

HotelInfo.Name: East Hong Kong
HotelInfo.Address: No.29 Taikoo Shing Road, Island East, Hong Kong, China
